title: 5 matite 2HB più 1 gomma
review: A inizio marzo, nella classe prima elementare di mio figlio, le maestre sono passate dalla matita “con scanalature” alla matita 2HB.Ne avevo una, ma è poi rimasta in classe nell’astuccio, per cui mi sono attivata subito a cercare su Amazon, per proseguire con i compiti a casa.Il prezzo è più che adeguato alla qualità dell’articolo (Staedler per me è “un nome: una garanzia”);si consideri inoltre la piacevole sorpresa di aver trovato inclusa (come da descrizione) una gomma da cancellare, ma “molto grande” (6,5cm x 2,5 vs -la classica gomma “da astuccio”- che misura 4cm x 2).Sono soddisfatta di questo mio acquisto per l’eccellente rapporto fra qualità, prezzo e quantità matite (più gomma da cancellare in omaggio!)

prod_name: STAEDTLER 121-2 BK5D Noris School Graphite Pencils - HB Degree (Pack of 5), Black
title: De vrais bons crayons à papier: solides et durables
review: On trouve de tout en crayon à papier, à tous les prix. Ces crayons ne sont pas les moins chers que l'on puisse trouver, mais le prix est plus que largement compensé par leur qualité. Ces crayons sont solides, tant la partie bois que la parie graphite. Si ils tombent, la mine intérieure ne casse pas comme c'est le cas sur les crayons bas de gamme. Lors de la taille, le bois est proprement coupé par la lame du taille crayon, au lieu d'être déchiqueté comme c'est le cas aussi avec les produits bas de gamme. Le graphite utilisé est de qualité, permettant un taillage pointu ou plus rond. La qualité d'écriture est bien là: ça ne bave pas, on réalise des tracés précis.Idéal aussi bien pour les adultes que pour les enfants, qui ont tendance à les faire tomber fréquemment et à les tailler souvent !

prod_name: STAEDTLER 121-2 BK5D Noris School Graphite Pencils - HB Degree (Pack of 5), Black
title: Los lápices de toda la vida
review: 🏭 Product Overview 🧱:Hoy quiero compartir mi experiencia con el lápiz Staedler Noris. Este paquete de 5 lápices de dureza variada es la herramienta perfecta para aquellos que amamos dibujar, tomar notas o simplemente disfrutar de la escritura a mano.✅ Nuestra Experiencia 🔧:Desde que adquirí este set de lápices, los he utilizado en diversas ocasiones y los resultados han sido sobresalientes. He probado su uso en diferentes tipos de papel y el rendimiento es excepcional. La suavidad con la que desliza el trazo es impresionante y permite un control absoluto sobre el grosor de las líneas. Además, el borrado es limpio y sin dejar rastros, lo que me ha permitido realizar correcciones sin problemas.📌 Destacados ⭐️:Una de las características destacadas de este lápiz es su durabilidad. A pesar de utilizarlos intensivamente, no se gastan fácilmente y conservan su forma afilada por mucho tiempo, lo cual es excelente para un dibujante como yo. También me ha sorprendido la ergonomía de estos lápices, ya que su diseño proporciona un agarre cómodo y facilita la escritura o el dibujo durante períodos prolongados de tiempo.🔰 Mejoras 🛠:En cuanto a mejoras, no he encontrado ninguna deficiencia significativa en estos lápices. Han cumplido con todas mis expectativas y no he tenido problemas con el producto hasta el momento.💰 Relación Precio/Calidad 💰:Al evaluar la relación precio/calidad de los lápices Staedler Noris, considero que ofrecen una excelente relación. Si bien su precio es ligeramente superior a otros lápices en el mercado, la calidad y durabilidad que brindan compensan completamente ese aspecto. Además, al ser un paquete de 5 lápices, su precio se vuelve aún más atractivo, ya que obtienes una variedad de durezas en un solo paquete.⭐️ Calificación General ⭐️:En resumen, mi experiencia con los lápices Staedler Noris ha sido sumamente positiva. Su calidad, durabilidad y desempeño han superado mis expectativas. No dudo en recomendarlos a cualquier persona que busque una herramienta de escritura o dibujo confiable y de alta calidad. Por todo lo anterior, califico este producto con 5 estrellas y definitivamente continúa siendo mi elección favorita para todas mis necesidades artísticas y de escritura. ¡Una excelente adquisición para cualquier amante del arte y la escritura a mano! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE
title: Ein Klassiker zum super Preis
review: Auch wenn auf dem Stift Noris "school pencil" steht, ist es ein Noris 120. Jedoch zu einem sehr günstigen Preis von 26 Cent pro Stück. Die Härte von HB eignet sich sehr gut zum Schreiben.Den Noris gibts mittlerweile seit über 60 Jahren und es ist ein erstklassiger Bleistift. Sauber gearbeitet, farbige Endkappe, über die man die Härte direkt erkennen kann, recht mittig sitzende stabile Mine und - man glaubt es kaum - noch Made in Germany.

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE
title: Stabil!
review: Hch habe mir die Bleistifte hauptsächlich für die Werkstatt gekauft, und hoffte dabei darauf, dass ein Markenname auch für mehr Qualität sorgt. ich wurde nicht enttäuscht! Meine bisherigen Bleistifte hatten die "nette" Angewohnheit, dass wenn sie einmal zu Boden gefallen waren, die Mine innerhalb des Bleistiftes mehrfach gebrochen war. Also war der Stift immer nur wenige Millimeter anspitzbar, bis dann die Mine wieder eine Bruchstelle frei gab. Nicht diese Stifte! Auch nach x-maligen Herunterfallen (in der Werkstatt leider ein normales Geschehen) brach die Mine noch bei keinem der Stifte! Die Dinger scheinen unzerstörbar! Abgesehen davon liegen sie gut in der Hand, und durch die auffällige Farbgebung finde ich sie auch im Werkstattchaos relativ einfach. Aber auch beim normalen Schreibgebrauch sind diese Stifte wirklich toll. Der Abrieb der Mine ist relativ gering, so dass man nicht alle paar Sätze lang wieder nachspitzen muss. Nur eine Kleinigkeit, aber auch erwähnenswert: die Stifte kamen wunderbar gespitzt an. Also: klasse Bleistifte!

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE

review: Son los lápices de buena calidad, y por la cantidad que viene el precio está muy bien. Aunque no se han roto ninguno, creo que en el empaque que viene tendrían que hacerlo más resistente porque, los lápices son delicados.

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE
title: Sehr gute ganz normale Bleistifte
review: Ohne Schnick-Schnack geliefert erhält man hier 50 sehr gute Bleistifte, von denen man bekanntlich ja immer welche verlegt. Die "Box" im Titel gab es nicht, sie kamen lose im Polsterumschlag, was aber den Stiften nicht geschadet hat. Die Stifte sind sehr gut, mir ist bisher keiner abgebrochen und beim Nachspitzen gab es auch kein "Mist, schon wieder ist die Spitze ab".

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE
title: Poor quality
review: Very poor quality and definitely not what I would anticipate from this brand. Impossible to sharpen as lead breaks easily, when a successful sharpen has been accomplished, they blunt far too quickly.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2024

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE
title: Listed as pencils ...pencils arrived
review: Well what really can you say about a box of pencils that have been put away ready for September.... my eldest nephew is moving up to secondary school... boo hoo ...however back to the pencils well they arrived within a day or two of ordering. They were in a ziplock bag not a standard pencil box (which not massive deal as obviously cuts postage & costs down for company and purchasers. For those complaining look on the bright side they could of been loose)Once again back to the actual pencils.....they were  Staedtler Noris school yellow ,black striped hb pencils! All 50 were accounted for and all sharp!Now as for them doing as should I can only comment on the 2 I tested and the 5 I have already borrowed, they worked well and wrote what I told them to, but I guess they could of made my handwriting a little neater but at this price I can't complain!!!Now I'll have to come back at a later date to update you on how well the pencils sharpened and how often they needed to be sharpened! Will also update any news on the performance of the rest of the set!!
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 June 2017

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE
title: Mal empaquetado (muy sucio)
review: Los lápices bien sucísimos todos. Es imposible usarlos sin mancharse y hay que lavarse las manos. Lo terrible es que son 50 unidades y vamos a tardar en gastarlos.  Los niños no tienen cuidado y me pondrán las paredes perdidas. El problema es la bolsa en la que vienen (negra/gris) que debe estar muy sucia de grafito o similar. Toda la caña del lapiz está sucia y al pasar el dedo con fuerza te lo llevas todo.

title: Not what they used to be.
review: I’ve bought these previously and they were top quality, made from cedar wood, pencils. The latest batch are made from ‘upcycled wood’, a grey composite which just won’t sharpen cleanly even with the official Staedtler pencil sharpener. Disappointing drop in quality.

prod_name: STAEDTLER NORIS SCHOOL PENCILS HB [PACK OF 50) LOOSE
title: Goods arrived in perfect condition
review: Yes these pencils are a bargain. At under £8 for 50 pencils it shows the mark up on  a leading Supermarket's 5 for £2,same pencils.This product comes in a white padded envelope and all pencils are bright and perfect condition. Having purchased these for a Primary School girl. These pencils should enable the pupil to do better at School.This German manufacturer is top quality and should give the means for studying and working hard at school etc.Full marks should be given to Amazon for stocking this item.So I'm giving these pencils a extra star. 6 stars. Highly recommended.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 March 2018

Queste matite hanno un ottimo tratto e sono sempre marca BIC . Con la Bici non si sbaglia mai . I prodotti sono eccellenti e soddisfano tutti o clienti . Anche i più esigenti . Io ho visto l'affare e le ho prese . In verità ne volevo una ma vedendo il prezzo e la quantità ho preferito comprarle in numero di dieci perché la matita è sempre comoda quando manca la penna o ne hai tante che non scrivono . La matita scrive sempre ! Me l'ha chiesta anche un operaio per fare un segno nel muro .

prod_name: BIC Cristal Original Ballpoint , Comfortable Biro Pens, Medium Point (1.0mm), Assorted Colours, Pack of 10
title: Boli de siempre
review: Es el boli que sirve para hacer traqueotomías, que aunque no vas a hacer una en tu vida, mola saber por las pelis que se lo clavas a alguien en el cuello y lo salvas, y te hacen una estatua y te dan las llaves de la ciudad. O si eres John Wick, es perfecto para sacarte a tres tipos de encima metiéndoselo por un oído o un ojo y sacándoselo por el otro.Para el resto de mortales, escribe correctamente y es económico. Compré este pack a un precio espectacular. Son los Bic originales de toda la vida. Claro que hay bolis mejores, pero un Bic nunca te falla. Es perfecto para llevar encima. Es el típico boli que si te piden no te imoprta prestar aunque sepas que no lo vas a ver más.

prod_name: BIC Evolution Graphite Pencils - Box of 12 - HB Lead with Colourful Striped Design - Wood-Free and Splinter-Proof, Yellow,Green,Pink,Red,Black
title: Serh gute Bleistifte
review: Schon die alten Ägypter nutzten Blei, um wichtige und weniger wichtige Informationen festzuhalten. Und das vor über 5.000 Jahren.Bis zum heutigen Bleistift war es freilich ein weiter Weg und ich fürchte, dass keine weltbewegenden Dokumente mit ihnen unterzeichnet, wohl aber womöglich konzipiert wurden.Heute sind Bleistifte in den meisten Haushalten zu finden und ganz sicher findet man sie im Mäppchen von Schülern aller Altersstufen.Die hier vorliegenden Evolution-Bleistifte von BIC kommen gänzlich ohne Holz aus. Sie sind sechseckig,  bestehen aus Kunstharz, sind komplett durchgefärbt und kommen in der Stärke HB daher.In einer Blister-Verpackung ruhen vier Stück; braucht man sie nicht alle, muss man sich also einen guten Aufbewahrungsort ausdenken.Dank ihrer Form liegen sie gut in der Hand. Auch Kinder – Testobjekt war hier meine siebenjährige Enkelin – konnte gut damit malen und schreiben.Anfangs hatte ich aufgrund von Material und Form ein wenig Angst, die Stifte könnten sich nicht gut spitzen lassen.  Aber diese Angst war unbegründet - in einem normalen Spitzer lassen sich die Spitzer mühelos spitzen.Hat man die Kinder , dann weiß man eines - sie lassen die Stifte fallen, und schon brechen die Minen. Dies ist hier anders, wie ein Bruchtest ergab. Auch mehrfaches Hinunterwerfen ließ die Minen nicht splittern.Fazit: Farbenfroh, gut zu handhaben und stabil – besser geht es nicht! Diese Bleistifte gehören in jedes Mäppchen, machen aber aufgrund ihrer Optik auch in Büros einen guten Eindruck.

prod_name: BIC Evolution Graphite Pencils - Box of 12 - HB Lead with Colourful Striped Design - Wood-Free and Splinter-Proof, Yellow,Green,Pink,Red,Black
title: Optisch sehr ansprechende Bleistifte
review: Optisch gefallen mir die Bleistifte sehr gut. Mit den frischen Farben und den weißen Streifen sind sie ein echter Hingucker. Die Stifte liegen gut in der Hand und lassen sich für holzfreie Bleistifte vergleichsweise gut anspitzen. Sehr praktisch finde ich die bruchfeste Mine. Durch sie ist es nicht dramatisch, wenn die Stifte mal hinfallen. Gerade bei Schulkindern ist dies Gold wert. Das Schreibverhalten lässt jedoch zu Wünschen übrig. So muss im Vergleich mit Bleistiften anderer Hersteller fest aufgedrückt werden, um „Farbe“ auf das Papier zu bekommen. Besonders auf glatterem Papier wie bei Schulbüchern fällt dies auf. Zum Aufzeichnen von Umrissen mit Hilfe von Schablonen auf Tonpapier, gefallen mir die Stifte dagegen gut. Auch wegradieren ist kein Problem.

Anspitzen lässt sie sich aber sehr gut und bricht nicht, passiert ja beim Anspitzen sehr häufig.Mir ist das Schriftbild allerdings zu dünn, wenn man nicht fester drückt, ist der Strich sehr hell und es kommt nicht genug schwarz auf das Papier. Manchmal muss ich nur einen Punkt setzen, das klappt hiermit nicht so gut. Zum Zeichnen und Schraffieren sind sie dafür aber besser geeignet.

prod_name: Faber-Castell TK-Fine-9760 Mechanical Pencils Wallet of 3 - 0.35, 0.5, 0.7mm, Green
title: Super Qualität
review: Die Qualität von Faber-Castell ist nach wie vor sehr überzeugend. Ich arbeite an technischen Zeichnungen und zeichne/skizziere privat sehr gerne damit. Durch die sogenannten "Fall-Druckbleistift - Minen" benötigt man keinen Spitzer, man arbeitet immer mit derselben Linienstärke. Zudem befindet sich am Ende unter dem Druckknopf ein kleiner Radiergummi. Dieser ist mir erst nach längerem Gebrauch aufgefallen und wirklich praktisch.Wer auf Qualität setzen möchte ist hier genau am richtigen Produkt! Lediglich die 3,5mm Minen brechen sehr schnell, wenn man diese zu weit herausfährt oder zu feste aufdrückt. Da diese sehr dünn sind und man da sich etwas an sanfteres Zeichnen gewöhnen muss einen Stern Abzug, nichtsdestotrotz ein sehr empfehlenswertes Produkt.

prod_name: Faber-Castell TK-Fine-9760 Mechanical Pencils Wallet of 3 - 0.35, 0.5, 0.7mm, Green
title: Great Faber-Castell leads once one of the mechanical issue was sorted out.
review: Pack of three Mechanical pencils. The 0.7 and 0.5 work fine. The 0.35 was problematic. The lead (graphite) inside constantly broke when pressing the top to reveal more of the 0.35 lead, and it intermittently slipped back into the barrel of the pencil when you finally get the lead to emerge and put it to paper. I Had to remove bits of the broken lead (and the other two leads inside the pencil), make sure no small lengths left inside, then very carefully insert a single 0.35 lead and started again. This problem seems to be solved - so far - now that there is only one 0.35 lead in the pencil. This is a mechanical issue, not the leads in the pencils. These are excellent and produce smooth and consistent marks on the paper used. In conclusion: Initial disappointment from usual excellent Faber-Castell products but will monitor and report back.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 April 2021

prod_name: STAEDTLER 120-0 Noris Graphite Pencils - 2B (Box of 12), Black
title: De vrais bons crayons à papier: solides et durables
review: On trouve de tout en crayon à papier, à tous les prix. Ces crayons ne sont pas les moins chers que l'on puisse trouver, mais le prix est plus que largement compensé par leur qualité. Ces crayons sont solides, tant la partie bois que la parie graphite. Si ils tombent, la mine intérieure ne casse pas comme c'est le cas sur les crayons bas de gamme. Lors de la taille, le bois est proprement coupé par la lame du taille crayon, au lieu d'être déchiqueté comme c'est le cas aussi avec les produits bas de gamme. Le graphite utilisé est de qualité, permettant un taillage pointu ou plus rond. La qualité d'écriture est bien là: ça ne bave pas, on réalise des tracés précis.Idéal aussi bien pour les adultes que pour les enfants, qui ont tendance à les faire tomber fréquemment et à les tailler souvent !

prod_name: STAEDTLER 120-0 Noris Graphite Pencils - 2B (Box of 12), Black
title: Los lápices de toda la vida
review: 🏭 Product Overview 🧱:Hoy quiero compartir mi experiencia con el lápiz Staedler Noris. Este paquete de 5 lápices de dureza variada es la herramienta perfecta para aquellos que amamos dibujar, tomar notas o simplemente disfrutar de la escritura a mano.✅ Nuestra Experiencia 🔧:Desde que adquirí este set de lápices, los he utilizado en diversas ocasiones y los resultados han sido sobresalientes. He probado su uso en diferentes tipos de papel y el rendimiento es excepcional. La suavidad con la que desliza el trazo es impresionante y permite un control absoluto sobre el grosor de las líneas. Además, el borrado es limpio y sin dejar rastros, lo que me ha permitido realizar correcciones sin problemas.📌 Destacados ⭐️:Una de las características destacadas de este lápiz es su durabilidad. A pesar de utilizarlos intensivamente, no se gastan fácilmente y conservan su forma afilada por mucho tiempo, lo cual es excelente para un dibujante como yo. También me ha sorprendido la ergonomía de estos lápices, ya que su diseño proporciona un agarre cómodo y facilita la escritura o el dibujo durante períodos prolongados de tiempo.🔰 Mejoras 🛠:En cuanto a mejoras, no he encontrado ninguna deficiencia significativa en estos lápices. Han cumplido con todas mis expectativas y no he tenido problemas con el producto hasta el momento.💰 Relación Precio/Calidad 💰:Al evaluar la relación precio/calidad de los lápices Staedler Noris, considero que ofrecen una excelente relación. Si bien su precio es ligeramente superior a otros lápices en el mercado, la calidad y durabilidad que brindan compensan completamente ese aspecto. Además, al ser un paquete de 5 lápices, su precio se vuelve aún más atractivo, ya que obtienes una variedad de durezas en un solo paquete.⭐️ Calificación General ⭐️:En resumen, mi experiencia con los lápices Staedler Noris ha sido sumamente positiva. Su calidad, durabilidad y desempeño han superado mis expectativas. No dudo en recomendarlos a cualquier persona que busque una herramienta de escritura o dibujo confiable y de alta calidad. Por todo lo anterior, califico este producto con 5 estrellas y definitivamente continúa siendo mi elección favorita para todas mis necesidades artísticas y de escritura. ¡Una excelente adquisición para cualquier amante del arte y la escritura a mano! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

title: High quality; though a bit frail
review: During today's kanji session I could already tell that these are some quality pens, they look great and smell even better (coca-cola?) when sharpened, but much like my previous set (similar model; retail bought), they do seem a bit frail, perhaps not ideal for someone who has an iron grip and write with a 60 degree angle.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 120-0 Noris Graphite Pencils - 2B (Box of 12), Black
title: LOS DE TODA LA VIDA...
review: Sin duda, según mi opinión, la mejor marca del mercado en lo que a lápiz se refiere.Lo que éstos lápices a mí me garantizan es que puedo afilarlos con la seguridad de que la punta y la madera no se rompan...cosa que, aunque pueda parecer algo trivial, todos sabemos lo que frustra tener que afilar cada dos por tres, (Tengo lápices de otras marcas que cada vez que intento afilarlos se rompen o sinó quedan astillas en la madera y resulta bastante incómodo escribir así).Me decidí por este pack por el precio, pero sí es cierto que yo los compre para mi hijo de 8 años y echo en falta más una goma o un sacapuntas, porque veo más lógico subrayar lo escrito en bolígrafo que lo escrito en lápiz (opinión personal).Pero aún así he de decir que lo volvería a comprar... Por lo tanto lo recomiendo sin lugar a duda.Sobre el subrayador, decir que funciona perfectamente. Realiza un trazo uniforme y sin fallos. Algo que me ha gustado mucho es el hecho de que la tapa quede perfectamente cerrada, incluso hay que hacer algo de fuerza, esto garantiza que la punta esté en perfecto estado en cada uso y que no se seque.A este producto le voy a poner 5 estrellas, por su calidad y precio. El paquete llegó en perfecto estado y en el tiempo indicado.Espero que mi opinión os haya ayudado.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Exceptional Quality for Sketching Enthusiasts
review: The Lumograph STAEDTLER Graphite Sketch Pencil is a true gem for anyone passionate about sketching or drawing. I've been using these pencils for a while now, and they consistently deliver outstanding results.First and foremost, the quality of the graphite is exceptional. The lead is smooth, allowing for effortless strokes and precise lines. Whether I'm working on intricate details or shading larger areas, these pencils provide the control and versatility I need.The range of hardness available in the set is perfect for various sketching techniques. From the soft and buttery feel of the 8B for darker shades to the crisp lines achievable with the 2H, these pencils cover the spectrum beautifully. The consistent quality across the entire range ensures a seamless transition between different hardness levels.The pencil's minimalistic design and the vibrant blue hue make it visually appealing, which is an added bonus for those who appreciate aesthetics in their art tools.In conclusion, the Lumograph STAEDTLER Graphite Sketch Pencil is a top-tier choice for sketching enthusiasts. The quality, range, and durability make them a staple in my sketching toolkit. If you're serious about your art and demand the best from your pencils, these are an absolute must-try. Five stars without a doubt!

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Staedtler Mars Lumograph Black: finalmente ombre nere e opache !
review: Ho acquistato queste matite Mars Lumograph Black perché ero rimasto molto contento della grafite 8B della stessa marca, contenuta nell'ottimo set da 12 Mars Lumograph "normali", anch'esso in vendita su Amazon.In effetti, questa grafite Mars Lumograph 8B è particolarissima. Molto nera e quasi "grassa", è poco cancellabile come se fosse una matita colorata ed in breve è diventata la mia preferita (allego la palette dell'intero set, a lato di un piccolo bozzetto che feci tempo fa per esemplificare l'uso delle varie gradazioni di grafite).È allora che sono venuto a conoscenza di questo nuovo tipo di matite della Staedtler, sempre Mars Lumograph ma di tipo "Black", anch'esse in grafite ma di colore molto più nero del normale per la presenza di una più alta percentuale di carbone; vedendole in vendita qui su Amazon, le ho acquistate per curiosità.Fatta esclusione per la 8B del set Mars Lumograph "normale" che è del tutto simile con la 8B di tipo "Black", le altre gradazioni non sono da confondere però, in quanto a resa grafica, né con quelle in normale grafite né con le matite a carboncino.Delle prime non hanno quei fastidiosi riflessi lucidi avendo una finitura opaca, e delle seconde non possiedono la friabilità propria del carbone.Sono pastose e poco cancellabili come se fossero delle matite colorate nere, ma a differenza di queste sono sfumabili anche con le dita, hanno una mina resistentissima e molto affilabile, e soprattutto sono di quattro gradazioni diverse: la confezione comprende due matite di gradazione 2B, due 4B, una 6B e una 8B.Io le uso spesso e con piacere perché queste matite Black consentono agli amanti di questo tipo di tecnica, semplicemente ripassando un sottile strato sulle zone fatte con la grafite normale dove si vuole che sia reso un nero più profondo, di attenuare anche l'effetto lucido tipico della grafite.Queste Mars Lumograph Black sono un complemento anche per chi ama disegnare con il carboncino: le rifiniture, i particolari e le ombre più scure possono essere aggiunte con profitto dopo la stesura del fissatore ottenendo risultati molto convincenti.Allego tra le immagini il confronto tra la matita Lumograph in normale grafite di gradazione 8B e la sua "gemella" 8B Lumograph Black: entrambe hanno la mina di diametro maggiore delle altre gradazioni: ben 4,5 mm., mentre per le Black 6B, 4B e 2B il diametro è di 3,6.Le Mars Lumograph Black sono contenute in una pratica scatola metallica con una funzionale cerniera apribile (molto comoda per coloro che disegnano sovente anche all'aperto o in altre svariate condizioni ambientali), ed inoltre, al di là dell'abituale eleganza, riportano intelligentemente su ognuna delle sei facce la gradazione (caratteristica comodissima per un disegnatore).Consiglio a tutti gli appassionati di disegno, professionisti e non, l'acquisto delle Lumograph black, perché la resa è in definitiva qualcosa di diverso: diverso dalle grafiti, diverso dai carboncini, diverso dalle matite colorate. Si ha un ibrido di cui davvero si sentiva la mancanza a livello grafico.P.S.:Ora che sto scrivendo noto che ne hanno prodotto un kit in cui le matite Lumograph Black sono tutte di gradazioni diverse, avendo aggiunto la HB e la 7B: le acquisterò non appena "nanizzate" queste.Spero di esservi stato utile.

title: Great art pencils
review: The original Staedtler Lumograph 7B (EB) was always my favorite but the 7B & 8B (EE) never quite fit in with the rest of the Lumograph drawing pencils, they were a carbon & graphite mix while the rest of the grades are graphite. Having them split into two lines gives so much more options. They are nice & dark, as dark as Cretacolor Neros & darker than Faber Castell Matte but not as smooth as either, you can feel just a bit of grab on the paper. You can erase but minimally & smudging/blending with stumps or tortillons is also minimal but that helps make sketchbook drawings stay less messy. This is a great & useful addition to any drawing toolkit.

title: Really dark and no shine
review: These pencils are exceptional. They are very black, not grey and leave no graphite shine.I do not use these for skin or shading because they don't blend out well. This isn't necessarily a bad thing. There are parts you don't want to smudge,  like eyelashes.I use caran d'ache grafwood for my skin as they are very soft and blend out well. Not great for detail though. Then I use Faber-Castell pitt matte pencils for most other parts of a drawing.Using all 3 brands enables me to get the best of them all.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Paying a little more is worth it
review: Amazon carries plenty of no-name and budget brand pencil sets, cheap, and they are usually fine. I have bought several without regret. But spending just a few dollars more for a box of Staedtlers is worth it. I do think they sharpen better with less lead breakage and last longer, but that could be me just getting better at sharpening (yes, there is a knack to it). The nicest touch is how the hardness value is imprinted on all six faces of the hexagon, so you can locate the one you want without having to rotate pencils to see the label. I don't know of any other pencil brand that has this. Remember that there are two different 12-packs--this one, which is mostly softer leads, and another that emphasizes the harder ones. Amazon can be overpriced for some art supplies, but not here--this is a very good price for this product compared to art stores and other online sellers. I might stock up!

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Mejores cuanto más los usas
review: He usado todo tipo de lápices 'negros' para los tonos oscuros, desde grafitos de distintas marcas, pasando por carbones normales, comprimidos, grasos, los Conté 1720, pasteles negros ... Bien por vaguería o porque soy demasiado principiante para darme cuenta, voy buscando un tipo de lápiz que me permita negros intensos, pero que luego no tenga que andar con fijadores para que no se me vaya o se traspase a la hoja de al lado. Los Conté igual se acercaban un poco pero siguen manchando allá por donde pasan.Estos cayeron en mis manos después de ver varios análisis. Al principio me resultaba algo extraña la sensación, ya que no son suaves como un grafito, son como una cera dura, pero los resultados me gustaron mucho. Alcanzan negros mucho más intensos que un grafito (aunque el Steadtler normal 8B no está nada mal) y no tienes ese brillo del grafito que puede ser molesto. A medida que los usas y te acostumbras vas obteniendo mejores resultados y te van gustando más. Se quedan bastante bien en el papel, no difuminan mal, no manchan ni necesitan de fijador. La cajita donde vienen en un buen detalle y el precio por 6 lápices está muy bien.Un excelente producto que va a gustar a los amantes del dibujo a lápiz.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Iconic pencil
review: These are excellent premium quality pencils by Staedtler for sketching. There are 12 x 8mm pencils in total ranging from 2H to 8B. The degrees of softness are: 2H, H, F, HB, B, 2B, 3B, 4B, 5B, 6B, 7B, 8B. They are presented in a nice metal tin which provides good protection and easy access. The highly distinctive blue, silver and black top livery is iconic and it hasn't changed in years.I have used these pencils before and they have never let me down. This set is excellent for building up tone in portrait or landscape sketches for example. They sharpen well without splintering, and are comfortable to hold and use. The graphite is super smooth on paper and does not scratch at all like cheaper pencils. The graphite also erases easily so you can perfect your work. There is something very nice and satisfying about a good quality pencil like this one. This is a great set for any artist or student alike. Recommended.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 January 2015

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: “These are real artist grade pencils.”
review: I hope I’m not the only one that wanted to see a comparison between these and the Faber Pitt-Matte set. I would first like to say I’m a fan of both brands but neither is my all time favorite brand, so I sway neither direction in a biased opinion.  So let’s begin. After a scale hardness check, these pencils were exactly on scale where they are claiming to be. Paint on these pencils are very nice. While holding them, they feel exactly like the regular Lumos. And after a few hours of testing these, I will admit that these are better than the regular Lumograph set, and they are slightly above the faber-9000 series, however, they fall short of being as good as the faber Pitt-Matte set.  Why?  Well they just don’t have that matte charcoal finish that the Pitt set is able to achieve. I have also did a review on that set if you happen to stumble across it here on Amazon.  Listen, don’t get me wrong, these pencils are definitely in a serious race here. And could possibly be in the top 5th or 6th place of the best woodcase pencils being made. And I don’t have to tell you there are thousands of wood case pencil companies. Hundreds of them claiming to be the best artist grade pencils.  If you can make it into the top 10 on my list, your pencils are definitely worth buying. And these Lumo Blacks are definitely on my list. These are the types of pencils that make you want to draw. I know you are not bound down to artistic creativity by tools, however, any artist will tell you, you can only get as good as the tool will let you.  So when you by cheap supplies, your progress will only go so far before you must upgrade to better supplies or your abilities will fall short of your capable talents.  ...A set like this will not only help you achieve better work, but will also make you strive to push them and yourself to higher levels of progression. I definitely suggest buying this set and testing them out for yourself. Or if you are also a collector like myself, add this set into your collection. I always buy 2 sets of every pencil so I will always have a brand new set to put into my massive pencil collection. I hope this review helps out
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2023

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: 擦筆やティッシュだと光沢がでます。
review: おそらくこちらを買われる方は、グラファイト鉛筆特有の反射が嫌で買われてる方もおられると思います。確かに濃くなればなるほど反射しません。(HBはちょっとだけ反射します)しかし気をつける点があり、8Bを擦筆やティッシュなどで擦ると、グラファイトと同じく光沢がでます。ちなみに擦っても全然ボケないしのびません。描き手が鉛筆の特性を理解して描く必要があります。唯一指で擦ると伸びますし、ボケます。手が汚れていいなら最初から木炭やコンテを選びそうですが。書き味の滑らかさでいうと、ハイユニやステッドラー青の滑らかさはなく、ユニなどの書き味よりも更に引っかかり感が強いです。

title: Für den Kunstunterricht
review: Diese Stifte wurden für den Kunstunterricht für die 7. Gymnasialstufe angeschafft. Die Zeichenart ist Schraffur und Schatten zeichnen. Die Stärkegrade sind sowohl farblich als auch schriftlich auf den Stiften gekennzeichnet und bietet damit eine sehr gute Orientierung. Die Stifte werden in einer Metalldose geliefert und somit sind die Stifte sehr gut geschützt. Sie verschließt auch gut, sodass sie sich beim Transport in der Schultasche nicht öffnet und die Stifte umher fliegen.Toller Kauf!

Le doy 3 estrellas por el estuche pero eso no te sirve para dibujar.... Optaré por otra marca como los faber que son mucho más cómodos.

review: Veloce come sempre la consegna, ma non tutte le matite salve.. La 2B è arrivata rotta.. Sinceramente mi scoccia fare il reso, vorrei solo che mi mandassero una matita 2.. Ho aperto il pacco, al tatto sono confortevoli, il tratto sembra ottimo.. Spero che sia così anche più avanti

prod_name: Winsor & Newton 490008 Studio Collection Graphite Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality for Artists, for Sketching, Writing and Drawing
title: Ottimo acquisto
review: Premetto che sono una neofita, sto facendo un corso per imparare a disegnare e, non sapendo bene quale tipo di matita fosse il più adatto a me, ho deciso di acquistare questo set da 6 matite in grafite (immagino che andando avanti imparerò anche come utilizzare le matite con un diverso grado di durezza rispetto a quella che uso di solito). Devo dire che sono rimasta molto soddisfatta, al momento riesco a sfumare bene il tratto e fare delle ombreggiature decenti. Inoltre mi è capitato di far cadere la matita un paio di volte (sono un po' maldestra, purtroppo) ma temperando la matita, la mina risulta intatta.

Os lo digo de verdad.....Que calidad...Verdaderas obras de arte sin pintar.  Claro quien no a probado muchos lapices no lo nota. Yo estoy enamorado de ellos. Han despertado mi creatividad.  6 estrellas o mas. No rompen las minas duran muchisimo. Pigmentacion y tonos infinitos. Calidad precio  inmejorable-.  Para Artistas de verdad.

title: Prima Stifte: robust, günstig, ordentliche Qualität
review: Die Stifte habe ich für Kinder bestellt.Mir waren die Markenbundstifte, die ich privat benutze, zu teuer und die bisher für die Kindergruppe verwendeten Bundstifte vom Discounter immer zu schnell kaputt.Mit den Big Evolution habe ich einen prima Kompromiss zwischen Preis und Qualität gefunden.Farbe ist schön, die Stifte robust und der Preis günstig.Weshalb nur 4 Sterne?- Farbe ist bei Holzbundstiften hoher Qualität noch etwas kräftiger- irgendwann brechen auch diese StifteWer jedoch etwas für Kindergarten/Schule/Malgruppe sucht, kann hier bedenkenlos zugreifen.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Quality mechanical pencil
review: I’ve been using the 0.7 model for many years. Totally my go-to writing tool. It’s so-well made, easy to write with, well balanced in the hand etc. I like that there’s the option to set a visual at the top that reminds you what grade of lead you are using. I always use Pentel Ain Stein refills, and always 2B, but that’s not a fact I hold in my head every day, so when I go to order refills the “2B” reference is useful.This is my go-to tool for writing notes at work. And has been for years.What I don’t like - it’s quite long, even after clicking the button to retract the nib. Having said that, it still fits in any case or bag that in which I transport it.Other things - give it good quality lead. It works brilliantly with Pentel Ain Stein leads. They’re smooth when laying down text (I don’t have any experience of drawing with this tool)When I first got it I used whatever 0.7 leads I had to hand, and it was awful. The above Pentel leads are now available a lot cheaper - and are significantly better.Hope that helps in your purchasing decision. I have amassed quite a ‘collection’ of mechanical pencils including Rotring etc, but this one is totally the best. Not just slightly better- a lot better. My ‘collection’ isn’t really a planned collection- it’s stuff I’ve bought over the years on the journey to find a really decent mechanical pencil.Pentel Ain Stein Leads are equally key, in any pencil. Very smooth.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Fantastic pencil
review: This pencil has been my daily driver ever since I’ve bought it, so I feel I’m qualified to give a thorough review.It’s a fantastic pencil. While I haven’t had the luxury of owning a Rotring or a super-high end pencil, I did use regular plastic mechanical pencils for years; the kind of cheap pencil that come in packs of 50. This pencil blows them out of the water, in every aspect except one (which I will get to).PROS:- well balanced, weight feels good when writing- the thing is a marvel of craftsmanship. Seriously, I’m still amazed at how much stuff they crammed into it- the extending barrel is convenient, doesn’t have much play- you can press down with a LOT of force before the lead recedes into the barrel- the grip is greatCONS- The eraser. As someone who has to erase mistakes constantly, the size of the eraser is laughable and didn’t last me two weeks. Luckily it comes with replacements, however they also don’t last long..-the end cap. I tried like hell not to lose it, but it’s just too easy to lose if you’re using the eraser

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Pentel Graphgear 1000 (0,3 mm)
review: Die Rezension bezieht sich auf den Pentel Graphgear 1000 mit Minenstärke 0,3 mmGrundlegend positiv hervorzuheben ist die hohe Verarbeitungsqualität: Das massive Metallgehäuse macht einen ausgesprochen stabilen und wertigen Eindruck. Das Finish des Stiftes ist mattsilber, während der Taschenclip und Teile des Druckmechanismus glänzend gehalten sind. Die Griffzone ist mit einer sehr feinen, rautenförmigen Maserung auf dem Metall und Silikonnoppen versehen. Die Maserung wirkt nicht ausgefranst oder unpräzise gefräst - ganz im Gegenteil -, was den guten Eindruck bezüglich der allgemeinen Verarbeitungsqualität bestätigt. An der Griffzone ist zudem eine Vorrichtung angebracht, bei der durch Drehen die verwendete Minenstärke angezeigt werden kann. Teile des Innenlebens bestehen aus (massivem) Kunststoff.Sobald der Taschenclip gedrückt wird, fährt die Spitze des Bleistifts vollständig in das Gehäuse zurück, was ebenfalls einen sehr positiven Eindruck hinterlässt - hierdurch wird einerseits Verhindert, dass Kleidung durch den Graphitstaub der Mine verschmutzt werden kann (beim Transport in der Hemdtasche z. B.) und andererseits wird die Spitze des Stiftes so beim Transport sicher vor Beschädigungen geschützt. Der Federmechanismus des Taschenclips ist auf jeden Fall stark genug, um ein versehentliches Auslösen der Transportsicherung zu verhindern.Unter der Kappe des Druckmechanismus ist ein Radiergummi angebracht. Dieser ist ca. 2 cm lang, kann also bei "Verbrauch" nach oben nachgeschoben werden (zum präzisen Radieren gibt es natürlich auch Radierstifte - diese sind nicht teuer, ich habe mir gleich einen mitbestellt). Im Inneren des Stiftes ist am Ende des Radiergummis ein ca. 2 cm langer Metallstab in Minenstärke angebracht. Er dient dazu, ggf. abgebrochene Minenreste aus der Spitze des Stiftes zu entfernen, sehr nützlich.Wer mit günstigeren Druckbleistiften gearbeitet hat, kennt sicherlich das Problem, dass die Mine "zu weit" vorgeschoben wird - und gerade bei festerem Aufdrücken oder der Verwendung dünner Minen gerne abbricht. Bei diesem Stift ist das anders: Es wird genug der Mine vorgeschoben, um den Stift kontinuierlich benutzen zu können, aber nicht so viel, dass die Mine bei der Benutzung abbricht. Für die intensive Arbeit auf jeden Fall sehr angenehm (zum Vergleich: Bei einem günstigeren Druckbleistift eines namhaften Herstellers wird bei einmaliger Betätigung die Mine ca. 4x weiter vorgeschoben als beim Graphgear).Für meinen Geschmack dürfte der Stift etwas "kopflastiger" sein, die Gewichtsverteilung liegt - meiner Meinung nach - nicht weit genug vorne. Das fällt beim Gebrauch allerdings kaum auf. Im Gegensatz zu (Voll-)Kunststoffstiften ist der Graphgear 1000 (natürlich) merklich schwerer.Einziger Kritikpunkt ist der Reibwiderstand auf der Griffzone: Im Gegensatz zu gummierten Stiften (hier im Vergleich zum Rotring Tikky) muss mehr Kraft aufgewendet werden, um den Stift sicher zu führen, da er sich etwas "rutschig" anfühlt. Das ist mit Sicherheit auch Gewöhnungssache, jedoch hätten die Silikonnoppen aus diesem Grund für meinen Geschmack etwas weiter aus dem Metall der Griffzone herausstehen dürfen (sie schließen gefühlt fast bündig mit der Metalloberfläche ab).Gerade wegen der guten Verarbeitungsqualität und dem angenehmen Arbeiten (Stichwort: Vorschub der Mine) bleibt es dennoch bei der guten Bewertung.

title: Pentel es calidad
review: No es el primer portaminas Pentel que tengo, de hecho creo que es el quinto. Pentel es sinónimo de calidad. Ya tenía este modelo en 0.5mm y estoy muy contento con el, pero me apetecía ampliar mi colección con uno de 0.7mm para bocetos o trabajar con madera. El aumento de diámetro se nota sin duda en cuanto a que la mina no es tan frágil, y apenas se nota en la escritura. Sin duda muy buena compra. Si lo perdiese (porque tras 6 años intensivos con el 0.5mm, sigue funcionando como el primer día), sin duda repetiría.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Great feel. Great value. Great warrantee.
review: I've bought 3 of these so far on separate occasions (all the 0.9 mm yellow version).  One was a gift for my 10 yo son, who kept borrowing mine, and won't write with anything else now.I love how this pencil feels in my hand and while writing. It is very well engineered, nicely balanced, and has a smooth mechanism. The auto-retracting mechanism when you clip in on you pocket is a nice touch. All around great design. I've only purchased the yellow one (0.9mm, HB lead) because I planned on mostly using it for marking wood for my woodworking projects and so needed the stronger/thicker lead, but I find myself writing with it all the time. It's just that pleasant to use.I had a problem with one of them (it broke at the yellow plastic part), and I contacted the Pantel warranty department since it was well past the 30 day Amazon return. It took them a while to respond (7-10 days, I forget) so I was initially concerned, but they responded saying they would send a new one and a label for me to return the broken one. Which they did, no questions, no hassle. Top marks for their customer service. Very happy.There are two things that could be better:1) There is one plastic piece in an otherwise all metal product. It is a weak point, and in fact where one of my pencils broke. But the customer service/warranty department has been great, so I guess if they continue like that (it has a lifetime warranty!), I can't complain too much.2) The clip is just folded metal and could be a bit sharp on clothes. This is actually a pretty common construction for clips on pencils and pens alike, but for $20+ I was hoping for better. I carry one of them with me pretty much at all times, so I'm a bit concerned the clip eventually will cut into the cloth. So far it hasn't, so I my concern might not be justified. Time will tell and I will try to update in 6+ months either way.Also, one thing I wish they had communicated more clearly: In order to set the handy lead hardness indicator, first loosen the conical end piece part. The indicator part should then spin feely. Make your selection and tighten it back up. (Finger tight is sufficient.)I got all of mine on sale around $13-$16. At that price you really can't beat the value. Full price is $23+, which might seem pricey for a pencil, but if you don't lose it, it should last you a very long time. I think it's well worth it even at full price if you value an affordable, quality writing/drafting pencil. (If you're prone to losing pencils, though, then your experience might vary. :-) )I highly recommend this pencil. (And seeing as I've bought this on 3 occasions, it goes without saying that I'd buy it again.)

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: MORE great pencils from the makers of many of my favorites!
review: SUMMARY:  All in all, I find this gift set a wonderful combination of great pencils, spare leads and erasers presented in a very classy box.CONTEXT:  The P-200 series of Pentel pencils have been favorites of mine for over 40 years, introduced to me by my engineer father, I used them from college (80's) on through my business career for drawing, note taking and sketching, and I still have the .3, .5, .7 and .9mm sizes on my desk today.REVIEWS: When I saw this Pentel GraphGear1000 Premium Gift Set, I immediately went to YouTube and started watching video reviews. Most were favorable, so I decided to treat myself to an early Christmas gift. I'm VERY happy I did.FEATURES: If the P200 series are light, nimble, no frills, highly effective pencil companions, the GG1000 series are their full-featured, sophisticated siblings. GRIP:  Even more comfortable in my hands than the P200 series (though the weightier feel might not be for everyone), the combination of knurled metal sleeve and rubber ellipses make a firm grip comfortable. CLIP:  The clip is a combination of a) very well-designed way to clip the pencil to pocket or note-pad, and also b) when the back of the clip is pressed, it serves to retract the lead-sleeve back into the tip ... this is not a trivial point. RETRACTABLE LEAD SLEEVE: One of the few disappointing experiences I've ever had with a P-203 (.3mm) was when the slender lead sleeve became bent ... a small bit of damage that rendered it useless. Retracting the lead sleeve back into the point not only protects the sleeve from damage, but also protects the pockets into which we thrust our pencils. A great idea. PUSH BUTTON TOP/ERASER/SLEEVE CLEANER/LEAD MAGAZINE:  The push button cap at the top of the pencil a) extends and allows the retraction of the lead into the lead sleeve, b) hides the combination eraser and sleeve cleaning needle (stuck into the bottom of eraser), and c) covers the lead magazine (under the eraser).  LEAD TYPE WINDOW:  Above the knurled grip is a rotatable window that allows the user to display the lead type they're currently using.FINER POINTS:> I've heard that setting the lead-grade window requires a slight loosening of the grip, but I haven't tried that yet. The video I watched made perfect sense of this, so if/when it comes up, I'll update the review here.> Those who prefer a very light weight pencil might find these too heavy. I like the weight feel.> The Gift Box is done well enough I've been using consistently, replacing each pencil in the box after every use.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: The best mechanical pencil you are likely to come across
review: In short: Fulfils all criteria to guarantee an excellent product experience.Looks: I have lost track of how many years I have had mine (best part of a decade now). They still look the business and are often asked about by my clients whilst I am using them. One was even stolen, so I suppose that makes them quite desirable.Construction: The retractable tip is just perfect. It has a slight springiness to it that not only cushions the writing/drawing experience, but also helps avoid lead breakages, although the modern hi-poly' refills are pretty good in their own right. Made principally of plastic and aluminium, it is light yet very robust. The combination of a knurled section and rubber grip is perfect - no readjustment or sweaty finger problems. There are no fancy gears that turn the lead around (as advertised by other products) neither have I ever thought to myself that I need one of those - one less unnecessary mechanism that can go wrong = minimalism = long-lasting = happy owner.Use: Always works well, very easy to carry around (very light). Solid enough construction to withstand severe punishment - mine has been submerged in water for ~3 days (flood while I was away) & dropped from a height of over 10m (~30ft) - accidentally dropped in the space between staircase - which obliterated the lead refills inside but the pen works just fine. If it was the cheaper plastics varieties of mechanical pencils then they would not have survived. I'm also sure that some of the more expensive varieties will not be able to boast this. Even if it did stop working, replacing them is not going to be too painful. As testament to how well these have worked, I now have 3 varieties of these that take different refill sizes, as well as a spare 0.5mm as my all-rounder when I have to jot down or explain anything on the go. The oldest one is pushing a decade in age and looks/works like new. [For the astute fans out there: yes, they did make minor changes in their construction over the years, but not to any detriment]Conclusion: I have never been let down, only pleasantly surprised. I would highly recommend this over any other product I have tried (including comparisons against other brands that are >4x more expensive). A fantastic product that offers excellent value and many years of great service. This product has never disappointed me and I'm certain that most will agree once they have had the pleasure of using it.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: NOT CHEAP, BUT WORTH IT
review: If you've got to do drafting, the Pentel GraphGear 1000 has got to be a top choice.  It works great, feels sturdy, and should be the last drafting pencil you'll ever need.  Very impressive.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Excelente calidad
review: Tiene una buena relación precio-calidad, tiene el costo de portaminas de plástico y al menos en el exterior es metálico. Su peso es muy adecuado para sostenerlo en la mano cómodamente, además que tiene un mecanismo que lo hace retráctil escondiendo la punta cuando lo transportas por dos razones no te rompes las camisas con la punta y se protege está cuando hay caídas del portaminas, la punta no se daña. Tengo las cuatro medidas desde 0.3 mm hasta 0.9 mm, todas tienen la misma calidad y el mismo peso, fácil de distinguir por los colores. Lo único que les falta es que le impriman la graduación en la tapa, porque viene solo con una etiqueta adhesiva que se caerá con el tiempo probablemente. Las gomas que tiene en la sujeción permite una buena y cómoda sujeción siempre y cuando no tengas crema en las manos o estén húmedas, en ese caso se vuelve muy resbaloso. En general es muy recomendable por su costo y su buen diseño y calidad.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 February 2016

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: The only pen for me!
review: This is my absolute favorite pencil as an artist, and the only one I've used for quite a few years. I got one in high school and used it for four years, until I was a college sophomore. It stood up to daily note taking and drawing for four years. In the end, the only flaw in this pencil is the plastic seam, since that is what broke. Still, four years is an exceptionally long time for one pencil to last, especially since it is the only one I used for those four years. I purchased a second one right after the first one broke, and that one is still in excellent condition a year later.This is an excellent pencil for any artist, but has been especially wonderful for me, as someone with bad joints. The grip is bigger than a standard mechanical pencil, so it isn't as painful to write for long periods of time, and the silicone ovals make it easy to keep your grip on it.Retracting the tip of the pencil with the clip is a unique feature of this pencil, and honestly a bit of a fun party trick. People are always surprised by it. I have never had problems with the clip wearing out or breaking, and since the tip is retractable, I haven't had it break or bend either.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: By far my favorite mechanical pencil
review: I like this pencil so much, I purchased all 5 sizes this time: 0.3, 0.4, 0.5, 0.7, and 0.9.  My favorite lead is 2B.  It's softer and much darker than the standard HB. H=Hard. The lead range is 4H, 3H...to HB, B...3B, 4B.  When I'm checking construction sites, I use 0.9 to write erasable info on wood, walls, and other materials, wet or dry, regardless of temperatures. Not so with Sharpies and wax pencils. In the office, I use 0.5 and 0.7 for paperwork, blueprints, etc. The British all-time favorite is 0.4. I use the 0.3 for adding tiny details to building drawings and it matches my love for 0.38 gel-ink (ultra-fine) pens.GraphGear 1000s are great mechanical pencils. The only ones with fully retractable pencil points. I use Pentel Clicking erasers instead of the endcaps. It seems like too much work to stop writing, pull-off the endcap, erase, then put it back on. In half that time, I've grabbed an eraser and done.  I had the same problem with the 0.7 pencil breaking like a couple of other Amazon reviewers. That blue ring in the middle of the pencil is plastic, which I didn't know until I found my pencil broken. Easy fix though. I put the two pieces back together and taped it super tight with black electrical tape - the good stuff (3M Temflex). Temflex is very durable, stretches a little, resistant to both water and extreme temperatures. 4 weeks later, my pencil still works like new and looks good. I kind of like the black tape. It's one more way of knowing which pencils are mine. Electrical tape comes in many colors. I plan to tape my other pencils too. So far, my new replacement 0.7 is not needed.NOTE: The price of lead refills varies a lot across Amazon. Also, Pentel has two sources. Ain Pentel is from Japan. I'm guessing the other is from China. ROtring, Staedtler, and Mars are brands well-known by engineers, architects, and draftsmen.  Faber-Castell is well-known in the art world. Presently, I trying Mr. Pen because I really like their gel highlighters and lower prices. So far, no complaints. But I have both Ain Pentel and Pentel waiting in the wings. Also, I don't care about the little bar code sticker on all my pencils because my hands never touch it except during lead refilling. Buy the GraphGear 1000. It's pricey but worth it if you write with pencil a lot.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 January 2024

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Bon
review: J'étais certain que je vais retourner ce porte-mine car il est trop cher. J'ai quand même fini par en acheter un deuxième (0,5mm et 0,7mm). Il est très confortable en main. Il a le long tube en métal pour servir de crayon technique. Et le tube se rétractera dans le corps du crayon une fois le clip utilisé.Bien sûr, cela aurait été bien d'avoir ce que les autres stylos ont aujourd'hui : la possibilité d'auto-alimenter la mine sans appuyer sur le bouton au bout, ou en secouant le stylo.La seule chose qui manque est la petite épingle généralement attachée à la gomme qui aide dans les rares cas où la mine est coincée dans le stylo.Une bonne addition est le curseur qui permet à l'utilisateur de régler l'indicateur de dureté du plomb. Ainsi, lorsque vous avez plusieurs stylos avec plusieurs pistes, on peut facilement dire s'il s'agit d'un HB ou d'un 4B.C'est aussi bien que Pentel ait des codes de couleur pour les stylos, donc le gris signifie 0,5 mm de plomb, le bleu signifie 0,7 mm de plomb, et ainsi de suite.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: An Excellent Mechanical Pencil; but improvements theoretically possible
review: This is an excellent mechanical pencil.  It's one you buy to keep; not use and dispose of. Undergraduate students looked at it with awe and respect (just kidding there- let's not get carried away).  It's very functional, but not the overt display of opulence of products made by jewelers.It writes very well, and has good balance.  The grip has that knurled surface that prevents it from slipping around when, for example, your hands are wet or dirty.  The action advancing the pencil leads is flawless..  Pencil leads can break when too much lateral pressure is applied, but it requires more than most other mechanical pencils.  The process of refilling leads is good.  No problems there.I like the design of that spring-loaded clip.  You ever find yourself upside-down when you didn't expect it?  It stays put in your shirtpocket or when clipped to your shirt's collar.After ~3-5 years I noticed some corrosion on the barrel of one i purchased.  This occurred after repeated exposure to humidity from being on the bathroom counter near the shower.  You wouldn't have that problem with plastic.  Some of the graphics looked weathered due to wear.  Could the black graphics be etched into the barrel?  Who knows how much a pencil like this would cost, however.The only weakness is that the eraser inside it (underneath the cap) tends to slide back when pressure is applied.  This doesn't happen with the eraser from the factory, but after I installed refills.  The eraser holding bracket just didn't grip enough (anymore) after installing refill erasers.  And so the eraser didn't stay put;' making erasure difficult and frustrating.  I know it's my own fault, with big Trump-like hands.  After putting in a new eraser, I couldn't re-form that bracket exactly again.  I believe that some writers might never use that eraser, opting instead for a separate one.Overall, a great product for those who need better than just a cheap throwaway pencil.

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Derwents are some of the best around
reviewer: Mz Nina, business consultant and aspiring artist
review: I looove this brand, also all their colored pencil lines.  I know everyone is Prismacolor crazy, but it is hype.  Derwents are just as good and I am a little partial to them simply they are the ones I learn to draw with even as a kid.  I remember my first Derwent kit that Dad bought me, 120 pencils and I was around 8 and we were livi9ng in Australia.I love the water color pencils, the graphite, the ink tense that you can actually draw on fabric with and it stays, and the color soft line.  I also have a few others, but those are my favorites.I would say there pencils are as good as any other including Prismacolor.Just make sure to get the right pencil sharpener no matter what you use.  Get a Derwent battery operated, which is still made or a Panasonic or a used HUNT-Boston, all of which are no longer made.  DO NOT GET X-ACTO, it chews your pencils up and constantly breaks the lead.INFO ON ELECTRIC PENCIL SHARPENERS:I am a color pencil artist, and you need to have either a Panasonic, "Hunt-Boston" pencil sharpener, otherwise your colored pencils are eaten.  NEVER BUY X-ACTO for colored pencils, X-ACTO will eat your pencils.  Until you can find a Panasonic or Hunt-Boston, or Hunt or Boston electric pencil sharpener, get this if you can find one, or the Derwent "BLACK" model as it had 2 holes, one for a longer tip and one for a shorter tip.  I have both.  I had bought the Derwent one as I have Derwent but also use Prismacolor and graphite.  Panasonic and Hunt Boston are NO LONGER MADE no matter WHAT anyone says.  I was lucky to buy a new PANASONIC electric pencil sharpener by trolling the net until I found on.  Bought a used Boston, model #18, used on eBay and paid waaaay too much.  It was pretty beaten up.Also, if you do buy used, get one in the best quality that you can and just pay the extra, I would say up to $35.  I personally would not spend more than that.  I paid $38 for my new Panasonic.Also, X-ACTO bought out "Hunt-Boston" and all new models are a 4 digit model number, the actual "Hunt-Boston" is only a 2 digit.  This issue is that X-ACTO still sells under the Hunt Boston name, and it is misleading as it now uses X-ACTO cutters, which do NOTHING but EAT your pencils.  I also do not like it when someone lies about what they are selling.I bought what I thought was a "HUNT" electric pencil sharpener, it came in a box that had the Hunt name and packaging, but when I opened it up it was a, you guessed right...  An X-ACTO!!  Said so right on the sharpener.Bought on line here at Amazon from Overstock.com, but I returned it and got a refund, including shipping as they were misleading.Hope this helps with those of you who are colored pencil artist.  Get a PANASONIC, HUNT-BOSTON or Derwent sharpener.Also, run a graphite pencil through your sharpener first thing every day and it will stay sharp longer since colored pencils are waxy and tend to build up on the cutters.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 February 2013

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: 前買った時よりマシになっている。
review: 以前６本セット缶を購入したが、「芯がボキボキ折れてまともに削れない」（実質使用不可能）という恐るべき低劣品質だった。今回缶デザインがリニューアル、もしかして品質も改善されているかもと購入してみた。ら、今のところ削っても折れない（！！）缶自体、かつての６本缶のペラい質感のものよりしっかりしているし、缶のプリント塗装も上質な感じ。蓋の下、鉛筆の上からラッピングされており、固定されてガチャつかず輸送されてきたのも勝因か。ダーウェントはヨーロッパメーカー（カランダッシュ除く）的に乾いた手応え、ステッドラーより肌理は粗め。が、粗過ぎない適度な肌理。今回H硬度も試したくミディアムを選んだが、かなり粗めでひっかかりのあるH硬度。発色は薄いが肌理が粗いのでソフトに感じる。B硬度は「こんなにネットリしてたっけ？」、全体に「こんなに粗かったっけ？」な印象。ガリガリした粒子もH硬度からB硬度全てにもれなく頻繁に出るので、肌理細かい効果を求める人には全くお勧めしない。概して缶蓋の作品にあるような木炭デッサンみたいなちょっとソリッドなタッチになる（向いている）。特筆すべき注意点は、表面が滑らかな傾向にある日本的な紙には向かない（粗いくせにツルツル滑って乗りにくい）。以前買った時より鉛筆の塗装は良くなっている（２分割した木の継ぎ目が目立たないし塗装も厚めになってムラも無い）。が、木の接着がスムースではなく、電動では問題無いが小型削り器ではガタガタと無理な力がかかってささくれがち、その振動で芯が折れやすい（やはり芯はもろい）。HBでも尖らせた芯先が砕けて折れやすい。定着もズバ抜けて悪く摩擦で紙面が汚れがち。以上、品質的にはドイツ・日本・スイス製より圧倒的に劣るが、肌理のある、鉛筆向きの紙にサリサリとドライな手応えで描きたい自分的には納得づくでの買い物。ただし、缶は蝶番が無い、蓋が分離するタイプ。さらに携帯すると中が偏ってバラバラになり不便。こういった缶の仕様だし、芯もあいかわらず強くはないので衝撃には注意したほうがいい。（使用始めで主に硬い硬度中心に使っているので、B硬度に使用に耐える強度があるのかは疑心暗鬼。使い物にならないようなら追記します）★ ちなみに下位ラインの『アカデミー』シリーズは違う（恐らく中国製）が、こちらは英国製。

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: 9h softer than 8h, otherwise perfect pencils.
review: So I did swatches of all the pencils I received (bought 12 hard and 12 soft sets) and was surprised at how dark 9h looked. I then start a swatch with 8h and it was much lighter. I thought maybe I just pressed lighter on the 8h, I continued with the rest of the pencils, and everything was perfect. So I did more comparisons of 8h and 9h with drawing lines, different shading, etc, and 9h is definitely darker than 8h, but whatever, I at least now know what to expect from both those pencils, probably just a lull in quality assurance that day. So a star off for that, butt other than that, great pencils, will buy again for their great price and (hopefully more reliable) quality.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2015

title: Great Starter Range Pencils
review: I love the quality of these pencils. I am taking a drawing class for the first time this semester and the range these pencils give me is great. I've had my teacher tell several other students that their supplies weren't adequate but has always just focused on showing me how to use mine. I don't know too much about pencils but if you're looking for a great starter range I would recommend this set.The only down side I have for the pencils is that the case doesn't allow for easy viewing and the pencils fall out fairly easily. However, I didn't really consider the case a huge deal because it stores them perfectly in transit. I just think it would be nice if the pencils snapped in and had a label along the bottom (not on the pencil) to know which pencil you're grabbing (because the pencils will rotate in the case).

review: This product only took a day to deliver. I also live in Canada, so that might be different for others. The graphite is pretty resistant to breaking, lays down graphite smoothly, and is pretty dark. It's not the darkest or smoothest I've drawn with, but it is super affordable. The overall quality of the pencils are still very good, artist quality. They're great for quick sketches, but excel in detailed sketches.

prod_name: Faber-Castell - Castell 9000 Art Set Pencil (Pack of 6), Green
title: I Don't Know How I Learned Without Them
review: I don't know why in the world I waited so long to buy some good drawing pencils! I have been sketching with whatever mechanical pencil I had in my bag for years with very little preference, but the way that my sketches have improved with these pencils has been dramatic! Now I feel comfortable creating full pieces of art in shades of grey, whereas before I would sketch lightly and then use other media to finish the piece. After ten years of sketching with, in retrospect, a highly inferior product, I feel confident that these are just what I needed to take the next step toward improvement.These are very high quality. They arrive sharpened, which is nice, since I'm used to colored pencils that arrive in dozens and take hours to sharpen. They sharpen well with a standard or high quality sharpener, and the graphite (even on the softer pencils) is strong enough to not crack in the barrel (a problem I had with some student grade pencils in high school art class). The case is nice, too, and has a soft matte-like finish to the touch. I imagine it will dent and prove less than perfect if thrust into a backpack pocket full of other materials, but if kept in between notebooks, it probably has a long life ahead of it.I bought a set for my best friend, and she is in love, too. This would make a great gift for any artist in your life, and is a good investment for your own arsenal of supplies if you are an artists as well.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 July 2014

prod_name: Faber-Castell - Castell 9000 Art Set Pencil (Pack of 6), Green
title: Very good pencils, worth the money I spent on them
review: Very good pencils. I have used these and found them to be very nice to use.I've compared these to my Derwent graphic set (Medium), and I find these pencils to be better. With eh Derwent ones the lead used to break a lot while sharpening but I never had that issue with these Faber Castell Pencils. These pencils also have sharper edges on the outside so I found them more comfortable to hold and grip. This pencil also weights a little more so they didn't feel almost weightless which is better for me. Through my tests the leads last longer than Derwent too, I don't know why the composition must obviously be different but they do last longer and hold their point a bit better.That's about it really, overall I would recommend these over the Derwent ones I used. That's about it really. Just don't take my review to include colour pencils from the companies as that a different game altogether and I haven't used their coloured pencils, I try to give all brands a fair shot.And although this doesn't matter in terms of performance but the Faber Castell Pnecils look nicer and have a better coating on the pencils themselves. The tin looks nicer too. While this doesn't matter it's a bonus at least since I find the green colour very easy on the eyes and It's one of my favourite colours anyway.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 September 2019

title: Love this pack for the 3H 4H &5H pencils
review: This pack has the ones that go up to 5 H and I love this for drawing because you can get a delicate grey from the upper H pencilsFirst let me say that this brand is one of the best made around.  Even the higher H pencils aren’t scratchy and won’t ruin your paper!  How lovely is that?  I used to use a different brand but they started sending their business to mexico and their pencils are worthless.This brand is worth the $$ you will spend so don’t fret about if you are making a bad decision....you aren’t!The wood doesn’t split or crack and stays firm around the pencil point.  I carve off wood until some of my pencil tips are almost 2 or more inches, the use fine sandpaper to give me sharp points for the best of details.  You can see these in one of my above drawings

prod_name: Faber-Castell - Castell 9000 Art Set Pencil (Pack of 6), Green
title: My Kid love shading with these
review: This is an amazing shading set of pencils. My kid recently started art classes and I purchased this from Amazon. Surprisingly I got same day delivery even in a Tier 2 Indian city. The pencils are already sharpened so they can be used from the moment the box is opened. There are 6 pencils and the case is made of metal. Overall good value for money

prod_name: Faber-Castell - Castell 9000 Art Set Pencil (Pack of 6), Green
title: A bit confused.
review: I’ve used Faber Cattell water-soluble pencils for some time and I absolutely love them. The company also makes pencils with a very slight tint (blue, green and maybe others). These are called “Green” so not unreasonably I thought they were tinted. It turns out they’re normal graphite and Green seems to refer to a type (rather than colour) of pencil. They come in a green tin. On checking I see that my other FB pencils are in a green tin, so I didn’t get what I wanted. However, they’re an excellent pencil and I shall carry on using them, but I’m still looking for a green tint………
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 December 2022

prod_name: Faber-Castell - Castell 9000 Art Set Pencil (Pack of 6), Green

title: Pens that delivers and a box to match
review: Like most art supplies they don't come with any artistic abilities.Good for noodling around tho, and you have a good selection of different hardness to choose from to find your favourite.The pen are just pen, although of high quality, but it's the attention to detail and the TIN BOX that pushes me over to a 4 on this one. Great box that will last so you can keep your things in one place without it falling apart on you, it is this level of additional detail you expect when geting brand names, not just the higher pricepoint and nothing else.All that being said, they are pens, and pretty good ones from what my non artistic mind can tell.

prod_name: Bic - Evolution Triangle - Triangular Pencils with Integrated Eraser - HB - Box of 12
title: Gute Bleistifte im praktischen 12er Set.
review: Versand/Lieferumfang:Die BIC Evolution Triangle HB Dreikant Bleistifte mit Radiergummi im 12er Pack kamen sicher verpackt und heil bei mir an.Funktionalität/Optik/Qualität/Anwendung:Die BIC Evolution Triangle Bleistift eignen sich gut zum zeichnen und schreiben.Sie haben eine blau-metallische Farbe und am Ende einen kleinen Radiergummi.Dieser ist, anders als es oft der Fall ist, qualitativ sogar wirklich gut; weder zu weich, noch zu hart, dass er das Papier verkratzt und schwachen bis mittelstarken Bleistiftaufdruck bekommt er gut weg.Durch den dreieckigen Schaft hat man einen guten und angenehmen Halt- und Schreibkomfort.Die Mine ist sehr bruchfest. Das Spitzen funktioniert durch die 3eckige Form nicht ganz mühelos, wobei er sehr ergiebig ist, sodass nicht so schnell gespitzt werden muss. Die Bleistifte sind holzfrei, bestehen aus Kunstharz und splittern dementsprechend nicht, wenn sie zu Bruch gehen. Außerdem sind sie deshalb kaubeständig.Die Minenstärke beträgt 4,3 mm und der Härtegrad ist HB.Fazit:Gute Bleistifte im praktischen 12er Set. Fürs Schreiben und Zeichnen gleichermaßen gut und für kleinere Fehler auch gleich mit praktischem Radiergummi am Stift. Wirklich gut.Vielen Dank, dass Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben, meine Rezension durchzulesen.Ich hoffe, ich konnte Ihnen bei ihrer Entscheidung behilflich sein. 😊

prod_name: Bic - Evolution Triangle - Triangular Pencils with Integrated Eraser - HB - Box of 12
title: Qualitativ hochwertiges Produkt
review: Bewertet werden die „BIC Evolution Triangle HB Dreikant Bleistifte mit Radiergummi - 12er Pack“.Verarbeitung & Benutzung--------------------------------------------------Die Firma BIC hat einen ergonomischen Bleistift entwickelt, der gut in der Hand liegt. Das gewählte Material vom Bleistift ist extrem robust. Dabei lässt sich die Mine dennoch leicht anspitzen.Der Bleistift hat den Härtegrad HB, eine Mindeststärke von 4,3 mm und ist vollständig ohne Holz versehen. Interessant finde ich, dass der Hersteller angibt, dass der ganze Bleistift kaubeständig ist. Ich kenne das aus meiner Schulzeit noch, dass ich das gerne gemacht habe, aber den Holzgeschmack nicht mochte.Fazit--------------------------------------------------Einen so robusten Bleistift hatte ich bisher noch nicht in der Hand. Zum Testen habe ich einen der 12 Bleistifte in der Mitte zerbrochen. Der Hersteller gibt an, dass durch das holzfreie Material das Produkt nicht splittert. Bei meinem Test konnte ich die Behauptung des Herstellers bestätigen. Eine klare Kaufempfehlung meinerseits.Wenn der Beitrag euch gefallen hat, würde ich mich über ein „nützlich“ freuen.

title: Herstellerversprechen vollständig eingehalten
review: Hierzu gibt es relativ wenig zu sagen. Hier habe ich aber noch keinen integrierten Radiergummi gefunden, der überzeugt.Oh, und das Anspitzen geht wegen Dreiecksform und Kunstharz nicht ganz so leicht von der Hand wie sonst.

prod_name: Bic - Evolution Triangle - Triangular Pencils with Integrated Eraser - HB - Box of 12
title: Im Grunde toll
review: Die BIC Dreikant Bleistifte "Evolution" stellen erst auf den zweiten Blick eine neue Generation von Bleistiften dar.Das, was wie Holz aussieht, ist gar kein Holz, sondern Kunstharz.Den Unterschied spürt man weder beim Gebrauch, noch beim Spitzen, denn das ist alles wie gehabt.Die HB-Mine ist jedoch eine ganz normale Bleistiftmine von guter Qualität.Dass sie in der Kunstharzhülle besser geschützt ist, als in einer Holzhülle konnte ich bei normaler Verwendung nicht feststellen.Der Bleistiftköper ist mit blauem Metalliclack überzogen, sieht ganz schick aus.Am hinteren Ende befindet sich ein klassischer Aufsatz-Radiergummi in weiß. Wunder darf man von diesen Radiergummis nicht erwarten. Bei intensivem Gebrauch sind sie schnell aufgebraucht und nur noch die scharfkantige Blechhülle ist übrig und bei nur gelegentlichem Gebrauch verschmutzen und verfetten die Radiergummis und fangen an zu schmieren. Ich persönlich verwende stets einen ganz konventionellen Bleistift-Radiergummi in der gewohnten Riegelform.Trotzdem nur 4 Sterne, da mich im Angebotstext etwas wirklich stört.Da steht, dass beim Kauen auf dem Bleistift nichts absplittern kann.Also bitte. Man soll nicht auf dem Bleistift kauen! Und wer sich das wirklich nicht verkneifen kann, der ist mit einem nicht lackierten Echtholzbleistift bestimmt besser dran.Auf Kunstharz herumkauen? Wirklich??Wie auch immer, insgesamt ein ordentlicher Bleistift der seine erwartete Funktion hervorragend ausführt.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: My favourite Mechanical Pencil
review: This is my third pencil now of this model.My first one was stolen by my Sister. She had one herself, but she wanted to take mine on a University trip which involved a lot of time out in the field. When she got back, she conveniently lost 'my' pencil and not her own (I had grounds to believe that it was actually her pencil she lost - which I was eventually proved right when she confessed to her crime).Anyway, the tension got so heated at one point that she bought me a new one right there on the spot. I should add that this argument went on for months. I simple wanted a confession. That's how much these mechanical pencils mean to us!With my second copy, we went the distance together. What makes these pencils so great is that they just have this perfect weight and feel. It genuinely feels like quality and it's rare to find all of the graphite broken inside. You can really hit the darker tones of the HB quite effortlessly while being just as able to be used lightly and for speed taking notes.I used my first copy back when I was at University. I had to do a lot of technical drawings of architecture or infrastructure and I can honestly say that it always allowed me to deliver the quality of drawing that I had in mind. My second copy was mostly used for a lot of note-taking and the occasional drawing.My new copy, as displayed in the photograph, is mostly unused for now. I only bought this particular ASIN because it came with the additional graphite. This is only a couple of quid more expensive than just buying the supplies individually - so I figured why not have a backup!In any case, I am prepared this time if my Sister plans on another heist...
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 September 2018
