date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 April 2023

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Derwent una garanzia
review: Ho regalato questo set di matite a mia figlia, io stessa ne ho uno uguale, per fare ritratti in chiaroscuro. A parere mio il miglior set.

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Great Starter Range Pencils
review: I love the quality of these pencils. I am taking a drawing class for the first time this semester and the range these pencils give me is great. I've had my teacher tell several other students that their supplies weren't adequate but has always just focused on showing me how to use mine. I don't know too much about pencils but if you're looking for a great starter range I would recommend this set.The only down side I have for the pencils is that the case doesn't allow for easy viewing and the pencils fall out fairly easily. However, I didn't really consider the case a huge deal because it stores them perfectly in transit. I just think it would be nice if the pencils snapped in and had a label along the bottom (not on the pencil) to know which pencil you're grabbing (because the pencils will rotate in the case).
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 November 2013

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Great quality, great condition
review: This product only took a day to deliver. I also live in Canada, so that might be different for others. The graphite is pretty resistant to breaking, lays down graphite smoothly, and is pretty dark. It's not the darkest or smoothest I've drawn with, but it is super affordable. The overall quality of the pencils are still very good, artist quality. They're great for quick sketches, but excel in detailed sketches.

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Buona qualità
review: Usate per corso di disegno su consiglio dell'insegnante. Vanno bene

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Love these crayons
review: I’ve bought these twice. They are so easy for my littles to hold and use and the color is great. They also last a long time and are really durable as in they won’t snap in half like smaller crayons. Just make sure to not lose the sharpener as it’s the only one that fits these crayons.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 January 2024

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Excellents crayons polyvalents pour divers supports
review: J'ai acheté ces crayons dans le but de les utiliser lors de formations sur différents supports sans avoir à s’inquiéter de la classique erreur du marqueur sur un tableau blanc.📦 Le packaging, une boîte colorée en carton, est attrayant et bien conçu.Ce que j’ai apprécié :💚 Pigmentation intense : Les couleurs sont vives et riches.💚 Polyvalence d'utilisation : Parfaits sur un tableau blanc, des vitres, ou des feuilles de papier.💚 Adaptés à tous, enfants comme adultes : Faciles à saisir et à utiliser.💚 Durabilité : Jamais ces crayons ne sèchent, pratique.Ce que je regrette⚠️ Toujours un peu embêtant à effacer : Ils s'effacent aisément avec un peu d’eau… mais il faut un peu d’eau.⚠️ Manque de détails : Ce sont de gros crayons, pas facile d’avoir un dessin précis ou une écriture fine.En conclusion, ces crayons offrent une polyvalence appréciable et une facilité d'utilisation, aussi bien à la maison qu’au bureau, à l’école ou dans le milieu associatif. Ça coûte un peu plus cher que des crayons à encre, mais ceux-là durent.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Färbt ab und das Kind ist bunt
review: An sich tolle Stifte, super weich, toll in der Hand... ABER da der kleine erst 1,5 Jahre alt ist, zahnt und sabbert färben die Stifte direkt alles ein. Er muss die Stifte überhaupt nicht verwendet haben, alles ist bunt, es reicht ein Tropfen Wasser auf dem Papier, Malunterlage, Tisch und die Stifte sind direkt "malbereit".Vorteil: wenn Kind dann doch mal was anmalt was vielleicht lieber nicht angemalt werden sollte, ist es schnell wieder sauber. Farbe lässt sich rückstandslos von allem abwaschen.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Comtenta
review: Pintan bien y acuareables:En contra el precio un poco alto.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Great for artists of all ages
review: These are great tools for artists of all ages, with a pleasant hand feel. Very versatile at mark making, can be used dry or like watercolour pastels and blend with water. Great for making bold and impactful art.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 September 2023

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Crayons "inusables" et solides qui fonctionnent sur ardoise Veleda !
review: Ces crayons Woody nous ont été conseillés par la maîtresse de notre petite dernière en CE1, car ils sont effectivement utilisables sur les ardoises Veleda et contrairement aux feutres, ils ne s'usent pas (en tout cas beaucoup moins vite) ! Les ardoises Veleda sont utilisées quotidiennement ici et c'est vrai que les feutres qui vont avec ont une fâcheuse tendance à ... défiler ! Du coup on a testé. Ces craies grasses tiennent très bien sur l'ardoise, sans forcer les couleurs sont nettes, vives. Après un petit coup d'éponge humide, c'est effacé. Comme ils ont une mine ça va très bien pour écrire. Ils sont bien assez gros pour ne pas se casser (on a eu peur que des chutes leurs soient fatales comme avec des crayons de couleur mais il est mentionné "incassable" sur la pochette, vu l'épaisseur et la texture, c'est bien possible). Et en plus un taille crayon est fourni quand la mine s'use (ça heureusement parce que vu la taille des crayons, le format est très particulier ;)).Le prix est un peu élevé mais je suis contente de les avoir eu en promo (13€ environ pour 10) et quand on fait le calcul avec leur durée de vie potentielle, tout est relatif...En photo, un dessin sur ardoise ... oui étant donné toutes les jolies couleurs ma fille n'a pu s'empêcher de dessiner au lieu d'écrire :)

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Très utile
review: Un produit parfait pour écrire sur divers types de support. Je m’en sers personnellement sur des petits tableaux blancs pour des notes et/ou calculs.Les avantages par rapport à des stylos pour tableaux classiques :- la durée de vie presque illimitée (celle ci étant réduite seulement en taillant les crayons mais la mine ne casse pas et il n’y a donc pas besoin de le faire trop souvenez)- ils ne sèchent pas si vous les laissez à l’air libre (c’est stupide mais c’est tout de même un gros plus)- possible d’effacer le tableau facilement même après avoir laissé l’écriture plusieurs jours (la ou avec les stylos classiques il faut frotter fort une fois que cela a séché)- la possibilité d’écrire un peu partout-la solidité (peut être manipulé même par des enfants sans que la mine ne soit écrasée)Tout cela fait qu’il est donc possible d’avoir un large panel de couleurs à relativement bas prix (d’autant plus que vous n’aurez pas besoin de réinvestir tout de suite dedans)

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: NA
review: NA

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: matite morbidissime
review: la mina è morbidissima ed è ideale per bimbi piccoli perché scrivono facilmente (non è necessario esercitare una certa pressione come capita con alcune matite). Questo comporta che ci si sporchi anche molto facilmente mani, ma anche vestiti e superfici, ma si lava via con facilità (basta un panno umido per le superfici e i vestiti basta lavarli senza pretrattare).Unica pecca è che l'unico temperamatite adatto è quello della stessa marca, per cui consiglio di comprare la confezione con incluso il temperamatite, altrimenti spendete molto di più.Le consiglio.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Fantastic - strong colour like felt tip but writes like crayon
review: These are much chunkier than any toddler mark making tools I've used before but are easy to hold and use with their non slip grip wood pencil like outer. They are round rather than the often found triangular grip but this means you can sharpen them with the oversized sharpener included.I did balk at the cost of this set but I think these crayons that look like pencils and are as strong a colour as felt tips are worth it. The drawing you can do with them is strong and colourful - much brighter than colouring pencils and you can even draw on glass and plastic with the mess easily removed with something like a baby wipe. Like crayon though it doesn't mark fabric well so greater protection for things like your carpet and sofa. I have tried scribbling on my brown fabric sofa and the brighter colours like red did make a line but it only took a baby wipe to remove compared to lots of scrubbing needed with crayola washable markers.You get that soft flowing feel crayon feeling in use - like silk crayons rather than the scratchy normal pencil feel.I will buy these over normal pencils again for my toddlers. 4+ will probably prefer more grown up looking pencils as these definitely look like toddler ones.Update 25/10/16 still love these and I've gone on to purchase the pack of 18 which is even better as you get a black plastic storage tray plus a paintbrush and sharpener in fitted sections. Once over painted with water the colours do fade a lot to look like watercolour. See before and after pumpkin pic.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2016

title: Robust, unterschiedliche Funktionen,super für Kinder
review: Man kann mit diesen stiften auf Glas malen (zb Fenster), man kann jedoch auch ganz normal auf Papier malen. Die 3. Funktion ist  mit Wasser möglich. Die Farben müssen etwas dicker auf dem Blatt sein und dann kann mit Wasser dann ein Aquarellartiges Bild entstehen.Die Stifte sind super für Kinderhände geeignet, da mein Sohn (2) oft Sachen durch die gegend wirft, brechen die meisten Mienen. Das ist hier absolut nicht der Fall. Jetzt nach 1monat testen kann ich sagen, alle Stifte sind noch Heile :)Dadurch, dass hier ein Anspitzer bei war, lassen sich die Stifte prima wieder in die Ursprungsform bringen und die Kinder können wieder weiter malen.Hier jedoch das , warum ich einen Stern abgezogen habe: Vorsicht bei dem roten Stift an der FensterfrontDas Gummi am Fenster ist beim abwischen etwas rosa geworden und ich habe es noch nicht wegbekommen. Falls jemand eine Idee hat, mit welchem Mittel das möglich ist, gerne eine Info geben ;)

title: Toller Inhalt, aber sehr ramponierte Verpackung :(
review: Wir haben die Stifte selbst schon für unsere Kleine gekauft und trotz dass sie vorher absolut nichts mit Malen anfangen konnte, liebt sie diese Stifte. Sie gleiten sehr leicht übers Papier, im Gegensatz zu anderen Buntstiften, sodass man tolle Erfolge erzielt. Die Wasserlöslichkeit ist bei kleinen Kindern natürlich ein unschlagbarer Vorteil und man kann völlig entspannt bleiben, wenn mal was auf den Tisch daneben geht. 😉Was ich allerdings super ärgerlich finde: bei der jetzigen Nachbestellung war die Verpackung ziemlich ramponiert und wir dachten direkt, die Stifte wurden schon benutzt (waren aber unbenutzt). Normal würde mich das nicht stören, aber diese Packung war als Geburtstagsgeschenk gedacht und macht so absolut keinen tollen Eindruck (habe zwei Beispielbilder angefügt). Wir werden sie (aus Umweltgründen) dennoch behalten, aber ärgern tuts mich trotzdem, etwas zu verschenken, das aussieht, als hätten wir es aussortiert... 🙁 Würde ich unter den Umständen dann vielleicht doch eher im Laden kaufen beim nächsten Mal.

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Good for starters
review: I'm really glad I made the investment for real artist pencils, having the different varieties of darkness has helped me a lot in the last couple months since I got them.  I don't do that full greyscale shading stuff, barely breaking ground into general shading, no way I can do that.  But it makes it a lot easier for my drawings because instead of how I did it before where I would just try to draw the basic shapes and general outline with pencil, usually mechanical, lightly and then as I went, each new "layer" would be slightly darker with the permanent stuff that I would trace over with pen as the darkest, but then when I inked the drawing, let the ink dry, and go back to erase before coloring, it was often very difficult to get rid of all the pencil lines because of how hard and dark I had to go with some of them.  But now with these artist pencils, I lightly do the basic shapes with the lightest pencil, and as I go up in "layers" I go one or two pencils up for a darker line with minimal effort amd barely any pressure.  The result is a group of line in varying degrees of darkness that can still be easily erased once I have inked the final outline and I don't have pesky persistent lines and pressure spots showing through my color.  PLUS because you are using multiple pencils per drawing, they last a lot longer before needing to be sharpened.  The one I used most, the 5H, lasted almost two full months before needing to be sharpened and I still haven't sharpened any of the others.  My only beef is a cpuple of them have one spot on the led where it's kind of scratchy and instead of gliding over the paper I can feel it catching.  These are a good set for a starter or someone who doesn't intend to do full greyscale art like me, I doubt I will ever need to move up to a larger or higher end set than this one.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 February 2020

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Beginner friendly, good quality for good price.
review: I personally had a great experience with these pencils. I used them for my introduction college art class and it worked for all the sketch prompts given. I am not a huge artist nor do I sketch often but for what I needed it was great. The case it comes in is definitely not protective but it held together perfectly fine just to keep them in place.

title: Very Good, Just Wish They Had Erasers!
review: These pencils are WONDERFUL! The only problem is... they don’t have erasers! Now I know that many fancy drawing pencils don’t have erasers, I’ve used all kinds of great pencils that have erasers though. Not having an eraser on the end doesn’t make a pencil “not cool”. I don’t know how hard it is to put one on... hence the four stars, it’s missing an eraser. Sometimes a tiny eraser like that can be more precise than the erasers you can buy that fit in your hand. I guess you could get the little ones you stick on top, but maybe just buy a drawing pencil with an eraser built in.

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Not enough tone difference between the H's and the B's
review: I had high hopes for this set of pencils, because it contained several pencils that I havent had in previous pencil sets - i think the darkest I've had was a 2B or 4B? And these went up to 6B - and I like how the B pencils get much softer and darker the farther down their scale you go. Unfortunately, though, there wasnt an extremely noticeable difference from the 6H all the way through to the 6B in this particular set of pencils. I need the softer darker pencils to be very blendable, and these just weren't. I made a chart where I colored a square using each pencil, in order, using the same amount of pressure in each one. There really wasnt a big difference. Then I tried to shade over the squares to see if the blended or smudged well, and you could still see all of the pencil hashmarks. On EVERY SINGLE ONE. I dont expect the H's to blend barely at all, but the hashmarks on all of the B's should have at least started to smudge. The way I draw consists mainly of shading and tone differences, ranging from really light to really dark pitch black.  I mostly use a stump to blend all of it together, and take turns alternating between my stump and my kneaded eraser to do the actual drawing, to bring out the highlights and deepen the shadows. These pencils just dont vary enough in the hardness for me. I'm going to keep them, though, because I just dont feel like going through the trouble to send them back just to get my five bucks back. I can always write letters with them, right?
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 February 2020

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Great value pencils but the plastic sleeve is really annoying
review: I'm definitely no artist and I haven't even done any sketching in well over ten years but I was keen to jump back in. I remember I used to like 2B pencils, but I thought I'd grab a mixed pack and try to gauge how they all lay down. The quality seems great for the cost, they're pre-sharpened. The shaft seems to be natural wood so there's some variations in colour of the wood, which adds a little interest more than anything else. The graphite is transfers nicely and isn't too brittle. I quite liked the 2H the 2b and 5b in particular.The only downside is that I find the plastic packaging sleeve bloody awful. It's too fiddly to keep the pencils in to keep them in good condition as the short top flap is very sharp and stiff and tries to dig into the leads as you slide the pencils back in. Can't even seem to get the plastic to accept a fold back in the other direction to get it to stay open.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 October 2018

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Good selection of skin tones.
review: A superb set of skin tone colour pencils from Derwent that are student grade and are excellent value for money. They lay down very nicely and blend quite easily. The pencils that have the colour names along the shaft, do have the colour at the base; however, do completely swatch to gain the true hues. The set includes an excellent white - perfect for blending and softening, plus a very good black. The pencils sharpen smoothly without any breakages or splits and are comfortable to hold. Of course, one could always want more colours, but with a little patient layering, a variety of skin tones are achievable. The colours are different to those in the 72 pencil watercolour set, but there are similar colours to be found there, as can be seen with the horizontal comparison bars on the swatch. All round, an excellent starter set before investing in the 72 set, plus a great bonus is that Derwent have a skin tone tutorial page.

title: スタイリッシュな色鉛筆。
review: 久しぶりに色鉛筆を手に取りました。発色は、水性なので優しい感じですが、とても鮮やかで澄んだ色ばかりです。力加減で濃淡も表現しやすく、絵にいろんな表情を持たせることが出来ます。最近、塗り絵にハマる大人が多いとテレビで見ましたが、なるほど、これは良い気分転換で癒されますね。

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Très bien, je recommande, même si le bois n'est pas top.
review: Les crayons sont biens, mais ne sont pas la folie non plus, ils sont secs, je dirais qu'ils se mélangent plutôt bien (certaines couleurs, plus que d'autres), ceci en utilisation comme crayon couleur normal. Comme aquarelle, ça va aussi.Par contre ils ont une qualité de bois aussi médiocre que les Prismacolor, à la différence que Prismacolor réussi à compenser avec la qualité de la couleur. Un des crayons est venue fendue jusqu'au bout et ouvert, j'ai mis un scotch pour par qu'ils se fende définitivement en deux en l'utilisant. Je n'ai pas rendue les crayons, car je n'aurais aucune garantie que les autres viendront sans problèmes, donc bon...Autre chose, les miens sont venues avec une forte, vraiment forte odeur de peinture, à croire qu'ils venaient d'être fabriqués.En gros je le recommande pour le choix des couleurs et pour le prix, si on veux économiser ses crayons plus chers. Je pense que nous pouvons créés toutes sortes de teints de peau à partir de ce set, peut-être juste rajouter quelques couleurs du pack de 12.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Derwent Aquarellstifte
review: Diese Stifte sind dafür gedacht Portraits zu malen, leider erfüllen sie nicht meine Ansprüche:1. Das Holz, welches die Stifte ummantelt ist von minderwertiger Qualität, beim Anspitzen bricht das Holz.2. Die Wischtechnik kann mit diesen Stiften überhaupt nicht angewandt werden, da man nicht verwischen kann. Selbst mit der Öltechnik zum verwischen und den Blendern mit Alkohol ist ein verwischen nicht möglich.3. Die Farben kommen sehr grob und nicht besonders stark deckend rüber.4. Die Farben welche als Marker auf dem Holz aufgemalt sind, sind nicht identisch mit den tatsächlichen Farben. Diese sollte man gesondert auf einem Blatt Papier vorher austesten.5. Beim Schummern ist die Struktur sehr sehr grob und ist für Portraits nicht geeignet.Leider ein Fehlkauf.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Well made
review: Excellent value

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Just what I needed for sketching!
review: As a watercolor painter I work out my detailed drawings on tracing paper first and then transfer the drawing to my good watercolor paper. I found a water soluble transfer paper that is a life saver, but I still need to draw faces and hands with very fine lines. Once regular pencil lines are gone over with water, they are sealed and not erasable. Regular graphite water soluble pencils dissolve in water but leave gray washes, which I like for value studies. For my regular work,  these water soluble colored pencils for skin tones are the answer! I can transfer the major part of my image, then finely tune hands and faces, even on small works, and the lines will dissolve.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: They arrived and brought joy with them
review: I ordered these while in the hospital with severe injuries and long rehab. They arrived and brought joy with them. I love how the colours compliment each other, I.e. the colours that are shades and hues simply are lighter or darker versions, which makes it easier to blend for colours you may not have. That being said the selection of colour families is quite good and there wasn’t a single pencil that I haven’t used! I love this set, and from what I’ve seen of other brands, Derwent is a top brand to me!

title: Des mines de graphite HB de qualité pour une écriture précise.
review: Les mines graphite Staedtler Mars Micro Carbon 250 sont un excellent choix pour ceux qui recherchent une écriture précise et nette. Avec deux étuis de 12 mines, ce blister offre une grande quantité de recharges. La dureté HB est polyvalente et convient à différents styles d'écriture. La qualité de fabrication de ces mines est remarquable, offrant une expérience d'écriture fluide et sans bavures. Si vous recherchez des recharges fiables pour vos porte-mines, ces mines graphite sont un choix sûr.

title: Lo ricomprerei 100 volte
review: Sono veramente soddisfatta dell’acquisto. La confezione contiene veramente tantissime mine di ricambio e la qualità è veramente ottima: meglio della mina originale che avevo nella mia penna.Ha una resistenza veramente eccellente: non si rompe nemmeno gettandola nello zaino pieno e non crea piccoli granuli quando si inizia a scrivere. Io la sto usando per sottolineare un libro con carta lucida e mi permette di tracciare linee sottili, dallo spessore omogeneo e nette, senza incidere la carta. Ottima anche su carta normale, dove non sbava per niente: apprezzatissimo visto che sono mancina

review: Ho scoperto il marchio Pentel durante un viaggio in Giappone, in cui son rimasto colpito dalla qualità dei portamine e delle mine a marchio Pentel.CONFEZIONELe mine arrivano all'interno di un pratico contenitore di plastica blu, di circa 7,5 x 2 cm. Il tappo non è ad incastro, ma ruota scoprendo un foro nel contenitore da cui inserire o estrarre le mine. In questo modo è più difficile che la confezione si apra per sbaglio disperdendo le mine ovunque.PRODOTTOLe mine che utilizzo e recensisco sono le HB da 0.5mm, adoperate con un portamine Pentel Graph 1000 CS. Il tratto si presenta deciso e spesso, ma non eccessivamente. La mina è incredibilmente resistente alla rottura. Ho notato infatti che si rompe meno frequentemente (praticamente mai) rispetto alle mine prodotte da altri marchi, anche molto famosi.Altro valore aggiunto, almeno per me che sono mancino, è il fatto che il tratto che lascia è molto pulito, privo di frammenti di mina che potrebbero sporcare mano e foglio scrivendo.PREZZOIl prezzo è assolutamente concorrenziale con quello di altri marchi, specialmente se rapportato all'eccellente qualità di queste mine.

prod_name: Pentel Ain Stein Mechanical Pencil Lead, 0.5mm HB, 40 Leads (C275-HB)
title: Gör det de ska.
review: Prisvärda och gör det de ska.

prod_name: Pentel Ain Stein Mechanical Pencil Lead, 0.5mm HB, 40 Leads (C275-HB)
title: Dureza
review: Tengo en diámetro de mina 0,9mm-0,7mm y me faltaba el 0,5mm para los distintos portaminas, todas con 2B (black) son más blandas y se consigue un negro más intenso. Son ideales para hacer trabajos en ambiente con humedad donde la tinta de bolígrafo falla, en trabajos de campo...Quizás al ser tan finas no se aprecia tanto su característica principal pero aún así van geniales.

prod_name: Pentel Ain Stein Mechanical Pencil Lead, 0.5mm HB, 40 Leads (C275-HB)
title: Nur zu empfehlen!
review: Die Minen sind zwar deutlich teurer als günstige Minen derselben Dicke von günstigeren Anbietern, aber man merkt entsprechend einen eindeutigen Unterschied. Erschreckend eindeutig. Die Minen brechen viel schwerer als günstige Minen und sie fühlen sich insgesamt besser und stabiler an, als vergleichbare Minen anderer Marken. Der höhere Preis wird meiner Meinung nach eindeutig gerechtfertigt. Besonders für passgenaue Druckbleistifte, wie den Pentel Graphgear 1000 sind diese Minen nur zu empfehlen.

prod_name: Pentel Ain Stein Mechanical Pencil Lead, 0.5mm HB, 40 Leads (C275-HB)
title: Grande QUALITE et arrivés SANS CASSE !
review: Ma plus grande apréhension sur cet achat n'était pas le produit en lui même, mais le transport. Je pensais recevoir des débris de mines dans un petit conteneur en plastique : il n'en est rien.Même si l'envoi était rudimentaire (une lettre bien scotchée), tout était en ordre !J'ai sorti toutes les mines pour vérifier leur état : le nombre de mine indiqué (40) est exact, et de plus aucune mine n'était cassée !Le système d'ouverture permet de transporter les mines dans leur étui sans qu'il risque de s'ouvrir (le haut pivote sur lui même)Et j'ai pu également remettre toutes les mines dans leur étui .. là aussi sans casse.Ainsi, sans même avoir des mois d'expériences avec ces mines, je peux déjà assurer que c'est de la qualité.Je conseille donc fortement, sans aucun soucis !(Si vous avez apprécié ce retour, votez "Commentaire utile" ! ça fait toujours plaisir)

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: My new go to pencil!
review: I love the new ARTEZA 120 Color Pencils. I normally use the Prismacolor Color Pencils and was looking to order another set, when I saw the Arteza Color Pencil sets. I went online and checked the reviews of the pencils. There were a lot of good reviews of the Arteza pencils, so I decided to try theme. The price for what I would be getting was very good. Over a 60% savings over the other name brand.Upon receiving and opening the set, I was very surprised at what I had received. It was a well packaged and organized sets of Color pencils. I brought out some of my other older and different brands of pencils for further review. After a series of tests, I can claim that these are on a level equivalent to the Prismacolor pencils. They sharpen and hold a good point and have a lesser series of lead breakage than the others being compared. They have a smooth feel when using and they blend very easily.In purchasing, reviewing and using the Arteza brand Color pencils. I feel that I have made a good choice. I have purchased and used several of their products and they all have presented me with great results. I hope that they continue with the quality and pricing of their products, and I look forward to getting more of the Arteza products for future use in my artworks.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Very good pencils
review: There's so many reasons why I really enjoy these pencils. I didn't start truely loving them until i got Hanna Karlzons books. In my Johanna Basford they worked well, but in Hanna Karlzon books they shine. So like with any pencil, paper matter.When I thought I had filled the tooth of it completly, is till wanted to add more shading i could still add layers of new colors. I find them effortless in blending, everything I have tried in those books.I have also found that you can safely buy from arteza. If there is any kind of problem they will fix it.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excelentes colores
review: Es un producto de gran calidad, los colores son vibrantes y son suaves al dibujar, mejores que las marcas convencionales, el envío llegó muy rápido.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 August 2022

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: 柔らかくて塗り易い
review: 絵画教室を開いていますが、通ってくる小学生（高学年）のために購入しました。それまで長いこと安くて硬い色鉛筆を使わせていましたが（一本50～100円）、何年も努力を続ける子どもの姿を見て、もっと色馴染みと発色の良いものを使わせてやりたいと思い、このセットを用意しました。色数が多いうえ、「柔らかくて塗り易い！」と喜んでくれました。画材がいいと腕も上がりますから、この先の作品がますます楽しみになりました。

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent for beginners
review: I’m not a professional artist, just a beginner who enjoys drawing with coloured pencils. These are really good for my needs, the 72 set has a huge variety of pencils. They’re very soft and pigmented, for the most part they layer well, but there comes a point when they don’t accept new layers and the surface can get very waxy. That’s the only downside, though for a beginner who wants a good quality set that isn’t too expensive, I think they’re great quality and value. The pencils keep a point very well so there’s no need to sharpen them frequently. They’re sturdy and don’t break easily. All in all, happy with this purchase.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great value for money; exceptional set! Definitely better than Prisma's
review: Great customer service (when I had a fault, I contacted them and they resolved it without any dispute!) and really quick delivery (arrived next day!)...The pencils themselves are fantastic. In the past, I've had a set from WHSmith, Marco Raffine's and Prismacolours. This set far easily outstrips them all. The colour range (in the 72 set) is fantastic - couldn't ask for a better range, especially in the reds, pinks and purples that are lacking in some sets! The pencil core is slightly wider than what I've used previously, meaning you don't go through the pencil as quick. The quality of the wax is definitely better than either of the WHSmith or Marco Raffine sets. Prisma's are oil-based and finding these better than prisma's may be personal preference. I like to lay down a lot of colour when I'm colouring (I can be very heavy-handed), and this destroyed my soft-core prismas -- I just blazed through a very expensive set owing to how I colour. If you're like me, and lay a lot of colour down and like really sharp points, then these are a fantastic choice.When it comes to colouring, the blending and layering is equal to prismacolours and better than marco raffine. The wax in the marco raffine, I think, is slightly harder (and lays down a bit scratchy) which is more noticeable after you've used these.If, like me, you now find the market saturated with choices of pencils, pens and colouring book to satiate all colouring enthusiast appetites, you won't go wrong with this set. I did hesitate at first, owing to the cost and being not sure of the quality; however, you really won't be disappointed. The colours are bright, there's a brilliant range, they blend and layer really well, and are great value for your hard-earned income with excellent customer service: what more could you ask for from a set of pencils?

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: very vivid blendable pencils - pretty good cost to performance ratio
review: i like to draw - it gives me a feeling of great satisfaction and pride as well as i really like getting into that "zone" drawing for 6-8 hours at a time - although i am not an artist by any means of the word.  i do not have any real techniques and i use references quite a bit.  so i just do it for fun and sometimes it comes out ok and sometimes not but the idea is to have fun.in these 3 years or so i have come to own Sargent, Marco Raffine (72), FC Polychromos (120), and recently Arteza (72), Prismacolor premier (72) which i have yet to use.the pencils came in a tin stacked with plastic 3 plastic trays - the tin is wrapped in a thin plastic bag.  when i received my pencils some of the pencils came loose and the tin cover was slightly opened - nothing appeared to be broken.the pencils have very vivid colors and sharpen very well - they do come to a very sharp point - however i have a habit of pressing too hard and the sharp point sometimes crumbles from my  heavy handedness.i was able to try out the pencils over the weekend and i broke them in with a picture of St Basils Cathedral in Moscow, Russia.they blend fairly well - i am lazy so i do not use solvents but then again i do not have experience with solvents.  i used the prismacolor premier colorless blender.i have attached my drawing - i look forward to using these pencils again.10-24-20 update. I am ramping up my production because I need to fill up my sketchbook of 100 sheets (canson universal) - this is my goal.I find that arteza colored pencils are great to work with. I think the colors are fantastic- prismacolor premier is creamier than these but these are great to work with too.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great colored pencils
review: For me, not an artist at all,but love to color and make beautiful things.These colored pencils are great. They are super smooth and soft and they blend super!I had a problem with 3 pencils were the leads broke everytime i sharpened them,  i messaged and asked Arteza if they could send me the 3 colors, but they refund me the total costst of the 72 pencils, which is GREAT service!I now ordered the 120 pencils, more colors to come  🥰🥰🥰I recommend these pencils for people who love to color in adult coloring books
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 March 2019

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Très satisfaite des crayons de couleur arteza
review: Très satisfaite de mon achat. J'aime beaucoup ces crayons de couleurs. Le rapport qualité prix est raisonnable. Je trouve les crayons arteza magnifiques. J'apprécie que les références inscrites sur les crayons soient numérotées et nommées. Le fait qu'il y ait une indication + pour leur résistance à la lumière est très appréciable. La mine est assez grasse et crémeuse. Le nuancier de couleur est assez bien pensé. Les couleurs sont intenses, lumineuses et assez couvrantes. Le soin porté à l'emballage est satisfaisant et la livraison rapide. Je recommande.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 October 2018

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Go for it ig!
review: It was very good Quality and all but i recomend drawing with toned tan paper if you're looking for a style that'll make ir look better and more expert-ish.
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 1 October 2021

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: These are great! Definetly worth it!
review: These pencils came in a nice packaged box with the colored pencils in a tin, they perform beautifully and are very pigmented. They don't really break that much, some colors are not as soft because of the lightfastness, and of course, prismacolors are better but these are great for an artist. They blend beautifully. I would advise you to swatch the pencils because the swatches on the tin are not really accurate. Very affordable and worth the money.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent product
review: High quality and a good value. These pencils lay down color very nicely, blend well and don't smear. The range of colors is fantastic and they sharpen perfectly with minimal loss. Highly recommended.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Mucho mejor de lo que imaginaba.
review: Francamente, muy buenos.Me han sorprendido muchisimo, tienen base cera, muy buena pigmentación, mezclan estupendamente, los colores son luminosos, y cuando los utilizas son muy suaves. Los colores tienen nombre, es decir, a uno de los verdes lo llaman matcha o absenta, es muy original, y tienen grabados unas estrellitas que indican la resistencia del color a la exposición solar, para mi muy útil.Puedes sacar punta perfectamente, no como ocurre con otros "de tan buena fama" que hay veces que te desespera poder afilarlos mínimamente. (en fin lo de siempre, cria fama...)He alucionado al leer, los titulos de algunas valoraciones, diciendo que no los recomiendan por el tema de la cajita o las bandejas, en lugar de valorar el lápiz en sí, tema que a mi francamente me es indiferente, ya que siempre acabo guardando mis colores, en un estuche de tela enrollable, mucho más práctico para mi.La caja es de metal, con cierre de visagra y las bandejas son de plastico, normal.En definitiva, sí, son equiparables a los prisma, por no decir mejores, y en definitiva el precio es fantastico. No puedo opinar en relación a los caran d'ache, porque no los he utilizado. Con respecto a los Faber, éstos son base aceite, Arteza base cera, los noto diferentes por este motivo, por lo tanto no valoro, es cuestión de gustos.Lo que sí me fastidia un poco es que no puedas comprar los colores individualmente, pero...Sin duda, la próxima vez, compro la caja de 120.Que quede claro, que mi valoración (por los años que llevo pintando y dibujando utilizando diferentes técnicas),  es sincera para ayudar a futuros compradores, al igual que yo obtuve ayuda al leer otros comentarios. (Arteza no me ha pagado por dar mi valoración). Un saludo.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 November 2021

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: A joy to draw and colour with them !
review: There is nothing to dislike about this pencils .  They layer beautiful , are soft core but can hold a fine point and they DON’T crumble ! Arteza colouring pencils are always highly pigmented , I owe also the old 72 count pencil set with smaller cores, this 120set goes a step further , 4mm cores !  You have every colour you will ever need in the beautiful Owl box , my only regret are those horribly flimsy plastic trays. There are 5 of them , colour swatches are on the bottom of the box and inside the hinged cover with names and numbers .  The pencil have on them self their name ,number  & COLOUR FASTNESS . The paint on the pencils is quite correct with the cores . The names ,I wonder who find them in the team ......KOALA GREY, COYOTE BROWN, MARMALADE ORANGE , FRUIT PUNCH , PEACHES AND CREAM  AND  NOW ONE OF MY FAVOURITES :  UNICORN PURPLE !!!  There is not one split pencil in the set.  I had a slight problem with my first set , the Customer care is second to none !  The next day was a brand new perfect set delivered !  I contacted the Arteza team by e-mail and in minutes they responded in minutes. Without any fuss or faff the wanted just my address ,where to send a new set .I owe also smaller sets of polychromos they are without a doubt good pencils , but not for me .  I  prefer how Artezas behave , and also price wise Polys are about £ 157 and Artesas £60 . Both are 120 count . I’m not an artist , but I like drawing and colouring . I was hesitating to buy the big Arteza set because I owe at least twelve big sets from all around the world , but my prefered pencils are Arteza , if possible I would give 10 stars to the pencils & 10 stars to the Arteza Customer Service !!! Thank you ARTEZA for Your beautiful products and Your exceptional Customer Care !

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Schöne, brillante, deckende Buntstifte
review: Die Buntstifte haben eine weiche Mine mit denen man schön deckend malen kann.Schade, das es die zur Zeit nirgends zu kaufen gibt

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: O produto é maravilhoso.
review: O produto é muito bom, houve um problema na entrega mas foi prontamente resolvido tanto pelo assistente da Amazon como pelo vendedor, foram muito prestativos e interessados em resolver meu problema.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 June 2020

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Muy buenos lápices
review: Son unos lápices muy buenos en relación a su precio. Me recuerdan mucho a los Castle (que me encantan) y la verdad es que no podría decir cuales son mejores.... Mezclan muy bien y los colores son brillantes. Son los típicos lápices que los disfrutas mucho al usarlos. Tengo prácticamente todas las marcas de lápices, desde los más económicos hasta los más caros, y estos no tiene nada que envidiarles a los más caros como los Caran d'ache Pablo, Prismas, Faber Castell... Junto con los Castle creo que es la mejor compra que se puede hacer sin gastar mucho. Por otro lado, quedé también encantada por la rapidez con que llegó el paquete en perfectas condiciones; la fecha estimada era el 19 de abril y los recibí el 12 del mismo mes. También tuve suerte con el precio (60€ la caja de 120). En definitiva, aconsejo comprarlos.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Calidad
review: Exelente producto

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Colori accesi e forti
review: Questo sicuramente è un buon kit per chi intende spendere poco rispetto alla media; all’interno della confezione (molto bella) troviamo 72 matite colorate. Il tratto è morbido, non c’è bisogno di un eccessiva pressione per la saturazione del colore. Niente male

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent pencils
review: These pencils are richly pigmented, and have a creamy core that blends beautifully, while still holding a point much longer than other wax-based pencils. These pair well with Prismacolors, but are gorgeous on their own. The best part about these pencils is the customer service this company provides—Arteza is responsive and helpful regardless of your issue. I would recommend these to beginners, as well as fellow illustrators!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Buenos lápices pero no han cumplido mis expectativas
review: Tengo bastante lápices de distintas marcas, mas profesionales y no tanto. Soy dibujante y me gustan probar cosas nuevas como lápices sobre todo. He oído sobre la marca Arteza diferentes opiniones y me decidí arriesgarme adquiriendo una lata de 72 lápices porque  costaba 0,51€ / unidad.La lata es muy bonita y compacta, parece ser durable. Los lápices están puestos en 3 pisos y sobre la tapa de la lata por dentro está la carta de los colores(72) puestos con sus números, el nombre en inglés y el rango de resistencia a la luz. En general son blandos, los colores son bonitos aunque haya según mi opinión muchas rosas y no son para aquellos a quienes gustan colores neutros.  Las minas son resistentes y pone que miden 4mm.  Para papel blanco están adecuados(hice mi carta de colores sobre papel color natural(sketchbook de la marca Hahnemühle con gramaje de 140g/m²). He podido hacer dos capas en general y no estoy muy satisfecho . Esta escrito que se pueden usar también  para el papel negro, por esto hice la prueba( 4ta foto) y me quedé decepcionado porque no sale como en la foto que ha puesto la marca(hice prueba sobre papel color negro de Talens(Black sketchbook de 140g/m²). Sobre todo los amarillos y rojos se ven fatal!  Así que no lo recomiendo(dibujar sobre papel negro). Además la mayoría de los colores de los lápices no coinciden con el color de su tinta(ejemplo fuerte el color Coral/A203/!). Te salvan los números en este caso.No me quedó claro la resistencia a la luz, ¿Cómo esta hecha? Y porque estos lápices son profesionales, tampoco. Probablemente por esa razón(resistencia a la luz).En dos palabras: los lápices no son malos, al revés, (tienen buen pigmento) pero sirven para trabajos no profesionales y si no se quiere gastar una fortuna. Aunque seria mejor que cuesten menos.Han llegado rápido y en buenas condiciones.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Love to color
review: I bought these a while ago and love the quality of them.  The colors are so brilliant.  My granddaughter spent the night and we colored together - she loved the pencils much better than the cheaper ones she has and she's only 10.  They weren't on her Christmas list, so Grandma had to order her a set ❣️

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excelentes sus graduaciones en barril.
review: Excelentes colores. Buena manufactura y lindas tonalidades. Con suficiente suavidad.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent crayons très bonne pigmentation bien glissant et gras type cire
review: Tout d'abord je suis ravie pour le prix car j'ai attendu une offre promo très intéressante (autour  de 23 euros ce qui pour la qualité des crayons les vaut très bien). Cela faisait longtemps que je les voulais, car j'ai une grande collection de crayons de couleur (Prisma, Polychromos, Guang Hui, Caran d'Ache, Giotto etc....) et j'avais eu de bons échos sur les réseaux sociaux en coloriage art thérapie, à un moment donné (très vite d'autres marques prennent le relais d'actualité).Perso, j'aime l'esthétique des crayons déjà (très beau) ils sont numérotés (bon pour ma part j'utilise pas de nuancier donc..) et alors l'odeur est  à tombé. Elle a une odeur de beurre de cacao, quelque chose de gourmand et d'assez fort (c'est très entêtant on aime ou pas perso j'adore, car je supporte pas les odeurs chimiques...). C'est une odeur proche des Prisma mais en plus fort je dirais, et perso, moi ça me transporte quand je colorie ;)J'ai commencé à colorier sur un colo, mais aussi testé sur feuille blanche, une sensation assez grasse glissante proche des Prisma dans la sensation de coloriage (je me permettrais pas de comparer sur la qualité, car les Prisma niveau pigmentation et qualité sont biensûrs au dessus), une sensation très confortable agréable, et plus facile je trouve que les crayons plus secs avec une pigmentation aussi bonne (après question de goût).J'ai trouvé quand même des traits communs aux Prisma plus que dans d'autres marques.Maintenant, là où je suis un peu déçu c'est le choix des couleurs (trop de vert notamment...) et avec quasi dans chaque tonalité de couleurs 2 couleurs quasi identiques  (pas décelable sur la couleur des crayons ne correspondant pas du tout à la réalité des couleurs une fois colorié ). C'est une marque intéressante et de bonne qualité bon rapport qualité prix (j'ai aussi les feutres que j'aime bien mais moins aussi pour le choix des couleurs...), même si vous trouverez encore mieux pour ce prix avec plus de crayons, pour ma part, ceux qui aiment le côté gras des Prisma mais que vous ne pouvez pas vous offrir dans l'immédiat, c'est intéressant, et ou pour compléter ces gammes de crayons.Nul part il est indiqué qu'ils sont à la cire mais pour ma part je pense que oui, car ils correspondent en tout point à la sensation de glisser et gras que l'on peut avoir avec et que j'aime tant.Une gamme à compléter pour des amoureux des crayons et ou très bien pour commencer...
date: Reviewed in the United States on 14 December 2023

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Very good price for quality
review: They blend very well, the pigment is great too. I love this set because the quality is great and the price is low. Some leads break kinda fast though, but its not a big issue for me personally.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Beautiful coloured pencils, but...
review: I was so excited when I got these coloured pencils, the packaging along with the pencils themselves are beautiful made. They colour amazing, the colours are very rich and they feel great using them. However, they sharpen horribly. Every time I'd sharpen them they would break, you have to be very careful and still they are fragile. I've been using these not even three months and already I have little stubby pencils. My other good pencil crayons lasted me years. Disappointed because they are beautiful and I enjoy usuing them, just sharpening them would stress me out!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Lovely wax-based coloured pencils
review: These pencils are perfect for using in adult colouring books and for hobby artists. The pencil colours adhere to the paper well, they sharpen well, although they are quite soft so don't stay sharp for long. Very good range of colours that blend nicely; not quite as well as very high-end pencils such as Polychromos (oil based), but still very good.Like all wax-based coloured pencils, miniscule bits of the nib break off while colouring. To avoid these tiny bits smudging your work, avoid using your hand to sweep them away. A soft brush is better. Minor smudges are easily removed with an eraser - I use a Faber-Castell eraser pencil. I wouldn't recommend using an electric eraser on these Arteza pencils as in my experience it's more likely to smudge than erase. I imagine that's due to a combination of the wax pencil and the plasticy type of eraser my electric eraser uses.These pencils are the Arteza Expert range, which appears to be their top-level range. I also have a small set of the Arteza Premium range, which are also very nice to use. I don't notice much difference between the two ranges, apart from the barrel shape: round (expert) versus triangular (premium).I think the normal price, which is in the low-£40 region, is very good value for the number and quality of the pencils in this set. I was lucky enough to buy on a Black Friday deal, so it was even better value.The Arteza customer services is really helpful and polite. I contacted them with a query and they replied within a few hours, and sent a replacement for a faulty pencil the following day. Best customer service I've ever had from a company on Amazon.
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 1 May 2022

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: excellent quality
review: these pencils are pro quality...they flow well, have great color pigment and are easy to use.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Super Qualität, faire Preis
review: Die Farben sind kräftig, die Mine ist weich, die kratzen nicht und gehen nicht kaputt beim schärfen. Sehr zufrieden 👌
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 November 2021

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: La mejor relación calidad/precio
review: Estos lápices son buenísimos por el precio que tienen. Tengo lápices caros (Policromos de FC) y otros más económicos (Zenacolor, Milan) y éstos son los que más me guastan de todos. Son cremosos, pero a la vez resistentes, se mezclan muy bien y la gama de colores es muy amplia. Los colores quedan muy vivos una vez aplicados. No soy profesional, pero la relación calidad/precio me parece imbatible. Compré la caja de 72 lápices y cuando vi que la de 120 estaba rebajada la compré sin dudarlo. Súper recomendables!
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 January 2024

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Prisma Beware!
review: I have a lot of colored pencils, from Dollar Store types to high-dollar European brands, but I can't resist checking out every new one I trip over, hoping for the best. Sometimes it pays off, and this is such a time. At the price, I was expecting something less than Marco or Colore quality. Instead, thus far the Arteza Expert is much like Prismacolor, specifically the Prismas I used to get back in the 1960s. Arteza has a little harder core and so requires a bit more aggressive touch. Both are wax-based, with both name and number on the barrel, but Arteza also indicates color-fastness, which is largely exceptional. The Prisma is maybe three-tenths of a millimeter larger diameter. Personally, I have not experienced the breakage problem with Prisma some people have, and am having none with these. They didn't seem to be very blendable at first, but some odorless thinner kicks them in the direction of oil painting. I tried intermixing with Prisma as a test and found it doable, if a bit tricky, yielding a look different from either. Overall, I am delighted with this find, enough so that I am going to order the 72 set as soon as I finish this review. I suspect they will get pricier when more people discover them.  Quick follow-up- The 72 set had a strong paint odor when I opened it, probably from being packaged immediately after the barrels were painted. The smell is fading fast once they are exposed to air to finish curing.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Um lápis especial
review: Gostei dos lápis, vêm num estojo de metal, as cores são muito bonitas e fortes, como eu gosto. Mas agora eu compraria uma caixa com 120 lápis dessa marca.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Schöne Farben
review: Sehr schöne Stifte und Farben, lassen sich auch gut vermischen. Ich finde es jedoch schade, dass es nicht die Möglichkeit gibt bestimmte Farben wie Schwarz nachzubestellen, da sich diese schnell abnutzen und ich mir nicht erneut ein ganzes Paket kaufen will.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 June 2019

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Almost perfect
review: Now Arteza hit on target! The 120 color pencil set is wonderful! The color selection is very good, which a balanced and rich selection. Thumbs up to purples and pinks. The cores are even softer than 72-color set. You don’t use almost any effort to draw.  I really  like to see names on pencils and the lightfastness, useful for professionals. Only three concerns: 1. I didn’t find if they’re oil or wax based, but they’re very very soft. 2. I miss fluorescent colors. They would  turn this set even more beautiful. There is an “fluorescent yellow “ pencil, but that’s not the case. It a lime yellow. 3. There are (for me) too much grays (14 shades, not including the two “blacks” and silver). I preferred less grays and more other colors, specially pastels. Indeed, the price is a bit expensive in my country (because of the import taxes). But, if you want a beautiful and good colored pencil set, I recommend this one. Thank you

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Ottima qualità a un giusto prezzo
review: Per prima cosa Amazon merita tutti i miei migliori complimenti, ho ordinato i pencils Arteza e sono arrivati il giorno dopo! È incredibile considerando che abito in un luogo sperduto della Puglia.I colored pencils Arteza, che dire, sono arrivati in condizioni eccellenti, la prima cosa che mi ha colpito dopo aver aperto la scatola di latta è stato l'odore di legno vero, legno fresco mescolato a quello dei pigmenti delle matite WOW!Il rapporto qualità prezzo è molto onesto, il fatto che estrarre ogni volta i colori dalle vaschette impilate le une sulle altre è un po' noiosetta come attività, ma non è un problema insuperabile.Ammetto che ero scettico durante l'acquisto, non conoscendoli mi sono fatto ingolosire dall'ottimo prezzo.Come si comportano questi colori sulla carta? Direi che mi hanno sorpreso, i colori sono a base cerosa, anche se ho il sospetto che ci sia una piccola quantità di base oleosa, perché non fa la patina tipica di questi colori (a meno che uno non lo voglia come effetto ci passa sopra un po' di bianco).Sfuma bene, si possono sovrapporre molti strati di colore se si usa una carta mediamente ruvida, io uso la Canson, e anche quando la carta è ormai saturata di colore se ne può aggiungere dell'altro! Ed è questo il punto a favore che mi ha fatto abbandonare ogni scetticismo.A scanso di equivoci, il bianco non copre i colori, se avete necessità di ottenere punti luce procuratevi dei bianchi speciali perché tanto è inutile sono poche le marche di colore che hanno il bianco che si impone sulle altre campiture.Per il resto i colori sono molto vividi, luminosi, adatti a stili pop ma sorprendono molto anche con il classicismo.Li consiglio per studenti e professionisti, sono un ottimo strumento, migliori di tante altre marche super blasonate.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great pencils at a great price.
review: Just received these pencils and I have to say I'm super impressed with their quality.  They arrived in pristine condition, safely nestled in their tin case within a cardboard sleeve and packed carefully in their shipping box.  I have many other brands of pencils in my collection, including Prismacolor Premiers and Faber Castell Polychromos and after testing these pencils, I can say they definitely hold their own against brands that cost a great deal more!  In appearance, they remind me a lot of Polychromos, with fully lacquered barrels in the colour of the lead and dipped ends.  The core is 4.5 mm thick so I expect these pencils will be quite durable.  Every pencil arrived in perfect condition, no cracked cores, no nicks or imperfections to be found.  They hold their points well, and don't crumble and break like Prismacolors often do.  The colour lay down is pretty effortless, they layer well, and the pencils are highly pigmented.  All in all, I'm VERY happy with my purchase and won't hesitate to purchase more Arteza pencils in the future.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 January 2020

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Buenos y duraderos
review: Se entregan en una caja de metal muy práctica, son duraderos y mezclan bien. Si eres profesional se quedan algo cortos, sobre todo a la hora de mezclar, pero los colores son muy vivos y tienes una variedad muy grande.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Preis / Leistung Topp + Spaß beim Zeichnen
review: Hallo zusammen,den Geruch beim Öffnen kann ich nur bestätigen, allerdings ist er ziemlich schnell verflogen. Also die Stifte erst mal auslüften lassen ;-).Anbei habe ich einen Farbchart angehängt und eine Zeichnung, die eigentlich nur zeigen soll, dass man mit diesen Stiften auch schön verblenden kann. (Ein ähnliches Bild habe ich auch mit den Polychromos gemalt und keinen großen Unterschied festgestellt. Das ist natürlich nur mein subjektiver Eindruck. Was die Farbbeständigkeit angeht, kann ich leider auch noch nichts sagen).Die Stifte haben reichlich Pigmente und sind Wachsbasiert, daher auch nicht mit Wasser verwischbar (Dafür gibt es die Aquarellstifte :-))Die Farbe läßt sich auch mit leichtem Druck auf's Papier bringen (Ok, bei manchen Stiften einfacher als bei anderen)Für mich sind sie eine passende Ergänzung zu meinen anderen Stiften, da auch ein paar aussergewöhnliche Farben dabei sind.Zu diesem Preis kann ich die Stifte nur weiterempfehlen.Noch ein Tipp am Rande, auf YouTube gibt es KünstlerInnen, die diese Stifte genauer unter die Lupe nehmen und wirklich gute Bilder damit zeichnen.LG

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Wonderful!
review: I absolutely love these pencils!! I'd have given them a 5 🌟 but while organizing the colours by the colour list it was missing 1 pencil colour and had doubles of others.Not a big deal there are many many other colours available to choose from!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Tres B bueno bonito barato
review: Bueno después de 4 meses usándolos mi opinión sigue siendo que en calidad precio siguen siendo buenos, sobre la exposición a la luz aún no puedo decir nada porque no he hecho pruebas, pero sinceramente me gustan mucho, por su buena calidad, cremosidad y sus colores vibrantes y no dejan huequitos en blanco. He probado en papel de block de dibujo canson de 180 gramos y he probado también en papel bristol y en ambos me gustan. Buena opción si no te quieres gastar mucho dinero y quieres calidad. Al lado de prismacolor o faber castell polycrhomos hay diferencia, pero obtienes resultados buenos igualmente.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Preis Leistung für die Anzahl der Stifte gut
review: Spitze der Stifte brechen schnell ab. Gute Deckkraft. Sehr kräftige Farben. Liegen gut in der Hand, sehr gut zum Zeichnen

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Buen producto
review: Todo bien

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: creamy smooth quality pencils for all artistic levels
review: These are quality pencils and the packaging is great, the metal tin keeps them secure. That’s a huge plus...So, I’ve used and own several brands of colored pencils, I’m not a professional artist.Although something went terribly wrong on my order and it took a long time to arrive originally was to arrive on 4th but arrived on evening of the 7th.. being a prime item and was promised delivery on 4th- that did bother me & chat was zero help.I want to specify Amazon chat not arteza.So shipping issues need to be approved on.ON THE PRODUCT NOW:)Worth the purchase-but price is a bit inflated in my opinion.Arteza should rethink this increase on price.Myself -if it continues to increase as it currently has been I won’t buy again. I’m partial to PRISMA, however,These are softer than most other WAX pencils on the market other than PRISMA premier. Thus giving Arteza an edge above others on sheerness and layering ability.These are quality I will give 5 stars on that.I noticed that some of the darker colors do tend to be harder leads and thus blending the darker ones lessens.They are a smoother lay down than other comparable brands.DO NOT confuse these with oil based or watercolor pencils as those are different and lay down differently. Arteza has watercolor pencils as well. Make sure you order correct as I have made that error 😂These are wax based.I’ve compared several brands to these and these are more like PRISMA than other brands.If I were comparing these wax based to an oil based pencil, Castle arts oil based run a close second in smoothness.. for an oil base brand.Anyhow, back to Arteza 😍The blunting of the tips I think is to prevent breaking during shipping so you’ll want to hone the tips by using them or a quick  mini turn in a sharpener will remedy it.I had no issue using my hand sharpener to do it, onlyTook one turn to achieve a point.These are harder leads BUT SOFT LET ME BE CLEAR THESE ARE VERY NICE CREAMY PENCILS and less breaking is a good quality on any pencil.So all In all these are worth the purchase for quality, blending and color ability.The colors are PHENOMENAL I love they differ in all aspects as they add more choices to my collection. So, you will be happy with these...Price point I’d definitely say is good but the recent increases has me a bit cranky.. I’d rate these around a 50-60.00 dollar USD for the 120 set. 80.00 seems a tad HIGH.But I’m not judging just one person’s opinion 😍You can’t go wrong purchasing these though, any artist expert or beginner would find these workable and desirable.I tried to purchase the 120 set as it was prime item and delivery was next day, however once order was placed it said it would be 5 days so that upset me and I cancelled it because that shouldn’t be happening on prime delivery items.I was very dissatisfied with that aspect and I couldn’t get a straight answer from Amazon.As I won’t let that reflect my product option 😎That issue shouldn’t really be sellers fault, I was bummed that I wasn’t able to get my 120 set as promised right now. But maybe I’ll try again in the future because these are EXCELLENT pencils.So if you need them ASAP ask about arrival time from Amazon I’m not sure if it’s due to holidays but it was upsetting I ordered them specifically because I was getting next day PRIME delivery And didn’t..And it’s unfortunate there seems to be some discrepancy on shipping.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Fantastic pencil crayons
review: Absolutely amazing pencil crayons.Packaged and presented beautifully in a metal tin box. Each layer has 24 different shades of colours. Each true to its shade.Each colour blends perfectly. I love the way these work. The more you play with them the better techniques you find too. I found many ways to work with them once I started playing around.On different styles of paper and card you can get different effects. Its worth trying each to find your favourite to work with. My favourite being on the card in the picture above. They also work well on canvas card and watercolour card.These leave a stunning shine to the colours. No lines at all left behind, all blended well and they're smooth on most types of card.The pencils are very nice to work with. They do not scratch the paper, they're smooth and creamy and glide across the paper/card. The colour comes out really strong whether using it lightly or pressing harder for shading.I'm no artist, I love the draw and I get through pencil crayons quite quickly so I needed to find some good quality ones.Now these are creamy as I said, when doing deep colouring you can use up more pencil than you want to. I would prefer this and have a smooth colouring journey than cheaper pencils that do not give enough colour and leave lines behind!I did have an issue with my first box, the leads were broken within the crayons so when I was sharpening, they were falling out mostly. After speaking to arteza customer service via email, I received fantastic support and was sent a new pack straight away. My second pack has no issues.I would definitely recommend these pencil crayons. They really are amazing quality. True to colour. Work in many different ways. Brilliant customer service too.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Arteza est devenue une marque de référence !
review: Je fais du coloriage pour adultes et je colorie quasi qu'aux crayons de couleur, et de ce fait j'en ai pas mal.Je coloris aussi bien aux prismacolors qu'aux polychromos ou alors aux pablos de chez caran d'ache.Mais alors là, je suis surprise par la qualité de ces crayons effectivement ils font penser à de vrais crayons professionnelles.Les couleurs se mélangent bien entre elles, belles pigmentations des mines, les crayons sont numérotés, se taille très bien avec le taille crayon à manivelle le Dahle 133,  je regrette seulement qu'il n'y en a que 72 tout comme les crayons aquarellables de la même marque et qu'on ne peut pas les trouver à l'unité car alors franchement ça serait top !Alors n'hésitez pas à prendre ces crayons de couleurs que vous soyez débutants ou confirmés en coloriage ou en dessins, vous ne serez pas déçus !Excellent rapport qualité prix !Je recommande +++
date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 December 2020

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great pencils but
review: I was in the middle of reordering them and noticed one of them was damaged. Not the end of the world but annoying.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 January 2020

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: A Very Good Set with Caveats
review: First off this would be an excellent budget set for a child, or an adult who needs to buy budget priced pencils for their coloring books.  For those purposes I would highly recommend them.  The color choice in the 72 set is excellent, though some could use more depth in shade and I wish there were a really dark inky blue color, however this set is more than enough to blend and get colors you want.  They are very soft in lay down and sharpen to a nice point which does not easily break as some brands do.  They layer and blend reasonably well though not as good as my Polychromos do but I did not expect that at this price point.  I love some of the colors, the pinks and purples and greens are well represented.  The big downside to sets like this is that you cannot buy individual pencils when one wears out, this is a huge disadvantage to someone like myself.  I like to be able to buy only the colors I use the most as often as I need to without buying a whole set.  I got this set for travel purposes, and it will be great for that.  It comes beautifully packaged in a metal tin with 3 layers.  The metal tin is covered in cellophane and then put into a sturdy form fitting box and then shipped in the Amazon box.  Because of this the pencils arrived in one piece with no damage.  Kudos for the packaging.  I can certainly recommend these pencils and they would be great for anyone starting out or who does not want to spend a fortune.  All in all a very good buy and I do not think you will be disappointed as long as you understand these are not the same as Polychromos, or Pablo's or other high end brands.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: I’m satisfied with customer service.
review: The set I got had blending and water-solubility issues. As they are, I’d categorize my set as a craft-level set, not a professional-level set. Nice pigmentation but limited usage (yes to coloring and cardmaking, no to blending gradients or multimedia work). Annoyingly, water doesn’t move it enough to use as watercolor pencils, but it moves it enough to smear the artwork. I’ve never been able to get a nice dry blend from watercolor pencils, which must have been the accidental mix-up that happened here (I think they crossed formulas accidentally). I have received a refund, Arteza has good customer service. But they also said they aren’t sure when the issue will be fully solved, so maybe don’t order these pencils for a while just to be save. I am satisfied with their customer service. I will have to reorder these maybe next birthday.The 72 set currently is on sale enough to make it crafting-level pricing, if you’re a crafter with no need for blending/gradients and water-related uses (multimedia, resist, use both sides of the paper). The 120 set is a bit pricy for craft-level supplies as of yet, for the specific set I received. There have been some awesome reviews, over years, so it’s probably just the one batch. Still, buyer beware. But great customer service.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 July 2023

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: These are amazing.
review: I've never used watercolour pencils before, bought these on a whim because they were an incredibly low price.Well, these exceeded my expectations. They behave just like watercolours, except better. You can get very fine detail with these, they blend wonderfully, and - what I'm happiest with - they are perfect for creating a base sketch without risking smudging, or visible linework, like you get when using pencil/graphite.This set is a great intro to watercolour pencils, and probably a great set for an intermediate watercolourist as well.  I highly recommend these.

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Pencil Power!
review: These pencils are excellent!Great value and perform well.They are not magic pencils, so if you can’t draw they won’t help. However, whatever your skills, the colours will look vivid and pleasing to the eye, even if your dogs dinner of artwork attempts are causing people to spit their tea out when you show them.Buy these pencils, they are marvellous!
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 February 2023

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: No son para profesionales, pero sirven bien.
review: Muy buenos para el precio. Tienen una curva de aprendizaje para no llevarte todo el color cuando aplicas el agua. Una vez que les conoces la maña son muy fáciles de usar. Los colores son brillantes, aunque no tan intensos como otras marcas de mayor precio. Para el rango de principiantes y aficionados que quieren probar la técnica o para artistas más avanzados que quieran agregar algunos detalles con lápiz de color a sus acuarelas, funcionan muy bien. Algunos colores se aplican más suave que otros por el pigmento que tienen.

Solides et une bonne prise en main, les crayons étant de forme classiques, ils seront parfaits pour les enfants dessiner ou les plus grands pour les cartes du BAC de géographie par exemple.Etant aquarellables, les dessins deviendront des œuvres. prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Good quality and a useful range of colours.
review: On the whole I am really happy with these pencils. I wanted a set that would be good for both dry and watercolour work and these fit the bill. I am more than happy with the quality. My only niggle is the difficulty I have in getting them to a really sharp point. I have tried various sharpeners and never quite managed to get them a sharp as I would like. It's not a big deal as a craft knife does the job. Otherwise they are excellent.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 August 2020
